results.description:
Please join us for our weekly gathering!

Please enter the space quietly so that we can support the meditation of the prior class in session. Feel free to bring snacks for the after hours tea party.


We hope to see you there!

Typical evening schedule: 
20 Minutes Seated Meditation 
10 Min Walking Meditation 
10 Min Reading 
30 Min Sharing Circle 
Tea And Snacks till closing @ 11pm

We are a young adult group (Under 35) practicing mindfulness in the tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:

www.tennis-buffs.com

 

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time.  I would like to stagger players.  You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left.  Thank you for your understanding.

 


Fridays, start 8pm
Cost $40, includes tennis, balls and food
6 Indoor hard courts

 

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends.

 

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.  You can choose to play as many hours as you wish.  Just tell me when you RSVP, when you arrive, or before the next scheduled match.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator

results.description:
On the last Friday of the month, our party moves to La Nacional, 239 West 14th Street (@8th Ave).  The rest of the time, we are at Stepping Out Studios. To get buzzed in to Stepping Out, dial 9 and the green call button on the key pad to the right of the building entrance.

Make sure to check our Facebook page (BluesDanceNewYork/events) to double-check our location!

*************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson

8:30pm-9:30pm - Intermediate Lesson

9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance


*************************************************************

Before you come in, it’s a great idea to take a look at this Etiquette Document that our community has compiled: http://bluesdancenewyork.com/etiquette

*************************************************************

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12. But if you pay for both at the same time, it's just $20 for the night!

If you volunteer, your admission to the dance is free for the night. Email [masked] if you want to be added to the list.

Bring dance shoes with slippery soles (for easy turning), or socks, especially when wet outside.

All ages. No bar, but it is BYOB. Water is provided.

There is no dress code, but hygiene is important and dressing up a bit is a nice thing to do. Prioritize comfort and ability to move!

**If you are taking the lesson, please plan to arrive on time. After 15 minutes have passed, students are no longer allowed to enter class.

results.description:
You've spent all week busting your hump! Now it's time to unwind, loosen up the tie, say inappropriate things, get hammered, and most importantly laugh til it hurts!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Hangout in the front room 8:30-9

Seating in the backroom at 9, Show starts shortly after!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and get over the hump with some laughs!

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Want to get out of the house or studio and refresh your artistic skills? Looking to meet local creatives, network and exchange ideas? Come to Astoria Drink N Draw! 

Location? Q.E.D. A Place To Show And Tell [masked]rd Avenue Astoria, NY 11105)

When? First Friday of every month, 9PM! 

Come enjoy a fun art night focused on figure drawing from a live model. No teaching or instruction, just a casual place to unwind after the work week, meet local creatives, refresh your artistic skills, or drink until you're talented! 

No need to be a pro - stick figures and hand-turkey’s welcome! Bring your friends or enjoy an evening of creative exploration and meeting local artists.  

Bring your own materials. Some materials will be available for purchase.

Instagram: @astoriadrinkndraw  |    twitter: @Astoria_DnDraw |   #astoriadrinkndraw

LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.

results.description:
A NYC tradition since 1994, The MOONLIGHT RIDE is a casual monthly bike ride on PEDESTRIAN WALKWAYS. UNDER BRIDGES, AROUND PONDS, UP HILLS, and WINDING IN/OUT OF MAIN BIKE LOOP in Central Park! 

We've already done this ride twice before, and it is a truly magical and super-fun night!

We'll meet near the giant Globe sculpture in front of Trump Tower at 9:45pm, on the NW corner of 59th St/CPW, then join the larger group that does the ride every month.


As all our other rides, we ask for a $5.00 donation for HOUSING WORKS. (payable in cash or via Venmo: joeyisraelg1@gmail )

results.description:
Is salsa dancing and learning on your bucket list? If so, then you should come to La Fama, a Salsa dancing party that takes place every Friday in Times Square. Come out, bring your friends, and leave your worries and stress at home. With admission, you can take our complimentary FREE salsa dancing class and dance all night long to great salsa tracks played by our DJ. Here are the details:

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Discount: One time discount->If this is your first time attending and you RSVP this event, you get in for $5.

Time: The event starts at 10pm  and ends at 2am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.

Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 10pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris unless there is an invited instructor. Here is silvio In action:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ep-cNukVLJo

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMy3EtfWqSY

So come out, take your first class and enjoy putting those steps into practice with great authentic salsa music and great people. Then you'll finally be able to go to the clubs and lounges and not just watch and stay on the sidelines, but actually dance and express yourself. Let's do it!!
results.name: Salsa Dancing in Times square with Free Salsa Class

group.name: LA FAMA - Active Salsa Dancing Group - Free Classes

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

This party is indoor/outdoor, so it’s going on rain or shine!

Join us for our Quiet Clubbing Party at the outdoor Studio Square Beer Garden! Drinks, food, and 3 DJs spinning at the same time to keep you singing and partying all night…Don’t like what DJ 1 is playing, you’ll have two other choices to dance and have fun too.

DJ 1 (Green): Top 40 hits, Dance, Pop, etc
DJ 2 (Red): The best of 80’s & 90’s, and 2K music!
DJ 3 (Blue): Hip-Hop, R&B

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

All Tickets Are Limited, So Get Them ASAP!

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: $5 Quiet Clubbing At Studio Square!

results.description:
Join the Time's Up environmental grassroots organization for a moonlight ride through Central Park. This is a fun, relaxing auto-free ride suitable for beginners. Enjoy the tranquillity of the park & its beautiful ponds & waterways: a nature lover's dream. Totally safe. Bike guides front & rear.

Meeting Place: Columbus Circle (SW corner of Central Park)
Date: 11/6/2015, Friday
Time: 10:00 pm

Pace: beginner

The ride moves at a very leisurely pace with a few stops to enjoy the scenery. We usually finish before midnight, back at Columbus Circle. Total mileage is under 10 miles. We do not require lights (although if you have them you should bring them), and any kind of bike will work.

For more information: http://times-up.org/rides/moonlight-ride-central-park
results.name: Last Minute Moonlight Ride in Central Park!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.

results.description:
Our Mexico trip will be postponed to 2016, but join me on a trip to Thailand for a tour designed for travelers to experience first-hand how the travel and tourism industry is combating human trafficking and the exploitation of children. I work for ECPAT-USA (an international anti-trafficking organization) and we are launching this trip in partnership with Altruvistas, a socially responsible tour operator whose main focus on traveling sustainably. We'll go on cultural excursions and see temples too of course, along with cuisine exploring. Travelers will get to meet with NGOs and organizations that provide trainings to prevent human trafficking, advance legislative reform, and promote children’s and women’s rights. We'll also get to see the amazing work being done on the ground to combat this human rights abuse, hopefully all leaving enlightened and inspired. Your journey supports these initiatives and helps ensure that children are protected. We are really excited about this upcoming trip and to take a group of travellers with us on this advocacy journey. Let me know if you have any questions!

Remember, RSVP here does not constitute actual sign-up.  Please contact Altruvistas direct for further reservation details. Or contact me, Sarah ([masked])

http://altruvistas.com/tourism-child-protection-code-is-the-focus-of-new-tour-to-thailand/

http://altruvistas.com/upcoming-journeys/thailand/
results.name: Travel to end Trafficking! THAILAND, November 2015

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

https://www.eventbrite.com/buttoncreate?text=Sign%20Up%20Now&size=small&color=%23ffffff&background=%23f96e26&logo=full

https://whistlestop-2015.eventbrite.com


Join us for an approximate 20-mile walk from Cranford to Somerville, New Jersey, on Saturday, Nov. 7, 2015. We will start at the N.J. Transit Station in Cranford and finish at the N.J. Transit Station in Somerville (Somerset County). This walk through central New Jersey will closely parallel the "Raritan Valley" Line, which has weekend service from Penn Station in Newark. Walk the entire distance or return to Penn Station from any of the train stations along the way- Westfield, Fanwood, Plainfield, Dunellen, Bound Brook or Bridgewater. Eastbound trains depart hourly from most of these stations to Newark's Penn Station on weekends. For additional information and schedules, visit www.njtransit.com

Although most of the miles we walk will be on level, paved suburban streets and sidewalks, we will walk through a few parks along the way. There will be plenty of food and drink options along the route, but everyone should bring at least one bottle of water and a few snacks or energy bars. Comfortable walking shoes, sneakers or light hiking shoes are recommended. Click here for directions and travel advice to and from this event. http://api.ning.com/files/ZahK2JNbKSukG3SIv5m5xwCMdksR9Maa8Nm4NaQJb9VAPIL5fHeOErmZBt7R7UquEwwyOCbZJ2fK64NUAbvEHWi9ogzb2Rwi/WhistleStopTurnbyTurn.pdf

We will meet at 8:00 a.m. at the Cranford Train Station and begin our walk at 8:15 a.m. Led by Bob Quinlan.
results.name: Raritan Valley "Whistle Stop" Walk

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center
Email: <a>[masked]</a>
Phone: <a>[masked]</a>
Meetup: <a>http://www.meetup.com/Lets-Meditate-Secaucus/</a>;
Twitter: https://twitter.com/#secaucusaol
Web: http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/secaucus

results.description:
Length: 16 miles

Elevation gain: 6000 ft


Difficulty: strenuous

Meeting point:  The main parking lot at Breakneck,   ~ 1/4 north of the tunnel :

https://www.google.com/maps/place/Breakneck+Ridge+Parking/@41.4446669,-73.9807845,771m/data=!3m1!1e3!4m7!1m4!3m3!1s0x89dd331a43579b4f:0x5416717295f588b!2sBreakneck+Ridge+Trail,+Cold+Spring,+NY+10516!3b1!3m1!1s0x89dd331e8d9a6fe9:0xd593cb8e38e817fa!6m1!1e1

Trail:


We will start going up breakneck, following the white trail to Beacon fire tower,


then down to the reservoir, around it to the access road, climb up Lamb Hill, then to the Fishkill Ridge loop , then join the yellow trail which takes us over Sugar Loaf back to the parking lot.  We are not going down on Breakneck.

There is a  train from GC, arriving at Cold Spring  at  8:07  AM.   If you need a ride from the station,  drop a comment bellow, someone can usually offer a ride.

This is a strenuous hike, with a lot of ups and downs, scrambling etc.  It is recommended for experienced hikers only.  Please bring your own map and headlamp. Hiking poles highly recommended.

++

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
results.name: Breakneck & Fishkill ridge loop

results.description:
I love this time of year. Just like nature is getting ready for Winter, it reminds me to take care of myself and not neglect my own personal needs as we move through this transitional period. Join me as we reconnect with our mind and body and begin our practice with a guided meditation followed by asanas (poses) for beginners and more! 

You can choose to pay $15 for a drop in class or take advantage of our 'class pass.' 3 classes for $40 or 5 classes for $60.

results.description:
Welcome to Thunder Mountain.

Located in Ringwood State Park, we are the closest shooting range to NYC, only 25 miles from the Tappan Zee Bridge. Thunder Mountain is a shotgun & clay target only shooting range that is open to the public. No experience or licensing required. Just show up and shoot!Thunder Mountain is open year round and is equipped with lighting for night shooting.

Depart Date: November 7th Saturday; Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 8:30 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 9:00 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Depart around 2:30 PM after group lunch & expect to be back in NYC at 4:00 PM and Flushing at 4:45 PM

Cost: Early Birds $49 for first 8 spots or booked 10 days in advance; Regular $59 afterward. Tickets without transport will be added later ($15 less than those with transport).

Includes: 25 ammos, 25 targets, gun and instructor, & round trip luxury van transportation from midtown Manhattan.

Additional Cost: Bring $22 cash for additional 25 ammos & 25 targets..

Buy Ticket Here: http://nov2015clayshooting.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

What to bring: Bottle of water, sunblock, comfortable clothes, and attitude to learn.

Maximum: 15

Refund Policy:

* $10 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 7 days.

After the shooting, we will lunch together at a local restaurant.

Click the link to Thunder Mountain Skeet & Trap Shooting Center

VENUE

The event will be held at the Water Tower Cafe within Google NYC. The address is 111 8th Avenue. Please enter by the entrance near 16th Street and 8th Avenue (closer to Citibank). 

We will have registration set up here. Please aim to be here between 8:15 and 8:30am so we can get everyone registered and into the venue before the event kicks off at 8:45am.


LOGISTICS


We are limiting attendance and will be selecting participants from those who register using the form here: http://bit.ly/gdg-devfest2015-cfp


Confirmed participants will have their RSVPs updated on the related GDG chapter page (GDG New York, North Jersey or Hudson Valley). We will also be inviting confirmed participants to a Slack community for pre-, during, and post- hackathon discussions.

Preliminary Agenda:

https://firehack.splashthat.com/



Google Mentors: (alphabetical by last name)

• Yufeng Guo - Cloud/Firebase

• Bret McGowen - Cloud/Firebase

• Martin Omander - Firebase/BizDev


• Elizabeth Padilla - BizDev/Pitch

• Jeffrey Posnick - Polymer/Firebase


• Terence Ryan - Cloud/ComputeEngine

GDG Mentors:  (alphabetical by last name)


• Lloyd Cledwyn - Polymer/Firebase

• Dario Laverde - Android/Wear


• Todd Nakamura - BizDev/Cloud/React

• Nitya Narasimhan - React/Polymer/Firebase/Android

• (Angular/GAE/GCE) Ajai Khattri


• (BizDev/Pitch) Aiko Thurlow
results.name: DevFest 2015: Firebase And Google Cloud Platform Hackathon

results.description:
VENUE

The event will be held at the Water Tower Cafe within Google NYC. The address is 111 8th Avenue. Please enter by the entrance near 16th Street and 8th Avenue (closer to Citibank). 

We will have registration set up here. Please aim to be here between 8:15 and 8:30am so we can get everyone registered and into the venue before the event kicks off at 8:45am.

** Note that to participate, you must submit the following really short form (1 minute or less to fill out):

bit.ly/gdg-devfest2015-cfp


We're really excited to announce that we've partnered with GDG NYC, GDG Hudson Valley, WeWork and Google to host FireHack.  This is a weekend-long Hackathon at Google New York and WeWork, with a focus on Firebase and Google Cloud Platform as the back-end technologies and your choice of front-end tech.  


Speakers

Martin Omander, Google (Mountain View)

Program Manager for Development Platform

Martin is visiting us from the Google mother ship in Silicon Valley, and is program manager for Google Developer Groups in North America.  He also wears awesome hats.  Martin will welcome us to Google as well as serve as a mentor throughout the event. 

Bret McGowen, Google (NYC) 

Developer Advocate for Firebase and Google Cloud

Bret originally hails from the great state of Texas, and now serves as a Developer Advocate at Google NYC primarily in the areas of Firebase and Google Cloud Platform.  Bret will deliver his awesome "No Stack Development using Firebase" 101 session, which he recently delivered at the NYC Code Camp.  He'll also give a brief intro to Google Cloud Platform, including fundamentals and deployment. 



Elizabeth Padilla, Google (Mountain View) 

Program Manager, Development Platform

Liz works with Martin as a Program Manager for the Developer Platform at Google in Mountain View.  She's an expert in the areas of community development, social media, marketing and public speaking, and will help teams prepare for pitches.  

Jeffrey Posnick, Google (NYC)

Senior Developer Relations Engineer, Open Web Platform

Jeff works as a Dev Relations engineer on the Open Web Platform at Google NYC, and will delivery a quick intro to rapid web development using Polymer. 

For more details about the event, visit the dedicated site: 

http://firehack.splashthat.com/


We'll also have mentors on hand to help you on your projects, as well as free food, prizes for winners and giveaways.  

*Note that because of the large number of groups participating, we will have a limited number of slots for participants. 

For now, please RSVP and get on the wait list for the event if you are interested in attending and if chosen we will reach out to you to confirm your participation.


* Full agenda and themes to come shortly.

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Hello Fellow DIY'ers,

I am so excited to be posting our next event in partnership with Habitat for Humanity. This event will be educational, inspirational and of course fun. I am looking for 4 additional women who are up for the challenge. Are you willing to learn construction at it's best?

Imagine either driving, or just walking passed a beautiful home you helped build for someone who is less fortunate. What if the new home-owner was outside watering his or her lawn, or just waiting with his or her child for the school bus? Would you go and talk to them? I would. See how they are doing in their home. This event will inspire you, take you to levels you've never been before.

Through the Critical Home Repair Program (CHR) we will help with necessary repairs on homes affected by Superstorm Sandy. CHR ensures the safety and the security of properties. For example, we may replace hardwood flooring, as well as perform interior renovation and including tiling, painting, installation and gypsum wallboard replacement work.

Volunteer activities include:

-Painting interiors

-Home construction and rehabilitation

-Rebuilding homes following natural disasters

-Bringing together communities by building neighborhood spaces

I know that the response will be overwhelming, so I decided to take all responses and qualify them, and then place them in a lottery. You will be notified of being selected.

Following the established Habitat model they rely heavily on volunteers and donated materials to help keep the costs low while serving as many homeowners as possible. No experience is necessary, but work boots are required. All volunteers must be 18 years of age or older.

Please contact Lisa at[masked] if you will be late.

Location @2834 Brighton 4th Street, Brighton Beach, NY

What they want you to know

Know Before You Go

You must be at least 18 years of age to participate on a construction site. And must be a GGDIY Member @ GirlsGoneDIY.com.


What to Bring & What to Leave At Home

Leave your unessential valuables at home. Unfortunately, we can’t guarantee a safe place to store them.
Water is available throughout the day. Please bring a reusable bottle to refill as you go.
Bring your lunch! (especially if you don't drive, most homes are in the suburbs)
They provide clean Port-o-Johns and hand sanitizer.


What to Wear

Wear comfortable work clothes since you will definitely get dirty!

Most of the homes we are currently building or repairing are not yet heated, however, warming stations are located throughout each home and provide minimal heat. Please dress accordingly - multiple layers are best.

For construction projects wear thick-soled shoes or work boots to comply with city & state laws. For safety reasons, you may be unable to volunteer if you don’t have the proper shoes.

Bring a bandana or skull cap to wear underneath the hard hat.

Habitat NYC provides gloves, tools, and safety equipment, although you are welcome to bring your own tools and safety equipment if you prefer.

Stay Safe

No smoking is allowed on site.

Site Supervisors and AmeriCorps Site Leaders are amazing and dedicated professionals who are responsible for your safety and can give you the best advice about how to build in the Habitat Way!

Cell phones and other electronic equipment may only be used in designated areas. Trust us, hammering and texting don’t mix.

If you cannot make it or even if you can, you may donate towards this experience by clicking the link below. Your donations are very much appreciated and will assist in getting this project rolling.

http://www.kintera.org/faf/donorReg/donorPledge.asp?ievent=1115862&supId=426723088&extSiteType=1

You're so fly, when you DIY!

Best Wishes,

Lisa

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation:

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.name: 7v7 Easy Saturday Soccer November 7, 2015

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Hello Hikers! 

Let's hike the Ramapo Torne/Raccoon Brook Hills Trail Loop.   It is the southern end of Harriman State Park climbs to two panoramic viewpoints and follows the cascading Stony Brook.   We will need more rain for a "cascading" Stony Brook.  It's a 9.5 mile hike and is considered moderate.    Click the link for more details.


http://www.nynjtc.org/hike/ramapo-torneraccoon-brook-hills-trail-loop-reeves-meadow

http://s225.photobucket.com/user/ortnergr/media/Ramapo-Torne-Loop.jpg.html


http://www.nynjtc.org/content/bear-tips-hikers


UPDATE 1 
So I did this hike last weekend.   It was a great hike.  Keep in mind that the hike says 6.5 miles, but this is from the trail.   It's about 1.5 miles from the train station to the start of the trail.   About of mile of that is on the road with traffic.    Parts of the trail are very rocky - more so than many of our hikes.   For a couple hours there are steep climbs and descents with some rock climbing involved.  

If you are driving you can park at the Sloatsburg train station and meet the group.   We arrive at approximately 10:15 AM.   Or you can park at the Reeves Meadow Visitor Center and meet us on the trail.   After parking find the red blazed trail and wait for the group at the beginning of the blue blazed trail (Seven Hills Trail).  I suspect we would arrive to this point 10:45 - 11:00 AM

Do me a favor guys.   I am finding many sign up for hikes and don't show up.   Please don't sign up unless you are fully committed to attending the hike.   If you have dinner plans that night do not attend since we most likely will not be back in time.   If you get invited to a dinner, a Madonna concert, or a personal meeting with Obama you will decline because you have committed to attending this hike.   Thanks!

As always it is a pleasure planning hikes for such a great group of guys!

Phil
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the NJ Transit Terminal in Penn Station.   Across from Duane Reade.

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE: This is the 9:00-10:30am Shoot - See the other meerup listed to RSVP for the later one that starts at 11:00am

===========================================================

A MESSAGE FROM JOHN: 

Thank you Monica for doing a bit of extra work to help reduce the prices for events which is in response to our recent survey.  How we made it work was by shortening the event time to fit 2 events in a 4 hour window.   

===========================================================

The Theme 

A comfy cozy photoshoot. Warm hand-knit sweater, coffee in hand, background of vibrant colored yellow, orange, red leaves in central park.

The following is my vision I have (as you can tell, it's not me in the picture):  

I have a blue, turquoise comfy sweater, I'll wear with boots and jeans.  ALl natural wavy hair, minimal makeup to make it look lifestyle. I'll bring glasses as a prop, we can try shots with and without them on.   The autumn leaves are beautiful!

The Place 


We’ll shoot at Strawberry Fields in Central Park. This tranquil section of Central Park was named after one of Lennon's favorite songs, "Strawberry Fields Forever." Location: West Side between 71st and 74th Streets.

ABOUT ME: 

Hi, my name is Monica, I love having the freedom to be creative.  If you have any ideas you would like to shoot, message me and I'll see what I can do to make it happen!  

I'm an accountant turned professional model. I like to have fun with TMD photoshoots! I'm not afraid to try new looks, poses, etc., feel free to direct me or fix my hair how you would like it. Don't be shy! Tell me the look you are going for! Get the best shots possible and direct me well.  Everyone here has something they want to learn or practice or try something new, many are here to get experience directing the subjects (me).  Yes: I expect many of you will tell me to move left when you mean right and to twist when you mean turn... haha, that is all the fun! If you are communicative and have fun with the shoot, you will be taking with you memories to last a lifetime! :) 

Follow me @

https://instagram.com/topxrahman/

The Shoot: 

4 Photographers will shoot 2 rounds of 10 minute increments, with the option to use waiting photographer(s) as assistant(s). The shoot should last between 1-1/2  hours. depending on how long wardrobe changes (if any) and my breaks are. 

3 photographers have 3 rounds of 10 min. each

2 photographers have 4 rounds of 10 min. each

1 photographer has me for 1-1/2 hours (with a few minute breaks every ten minutes).   

HOW TO PAY:


Payment for this meetup is done through TheModel'sDen Paypal account.  After you RSVP an invoice will be sent within a few hours for payment. 

Invoices will be sent to the email you will provide.    

Balance of $35 in cash is due the day of the event, plus any surcharges you may have agreed to. -  Please bring exact change.

==================== 

CANCELLATIONS: 

Please note! -  Events are not cancelled because of inclement weather.  I will make the decision no less than 2 hours before the event.  You will be notified by all the following means:  posting on this event page; email; a text message and a call if no response is received from you.

ALWAYS Check this event page 2 hours before the event starts to be kept informed of the status.  

==================== 

Why TMD? 

So many groups are crowded with photographers, a massive paparazzi nightmare.  At TMD, it's just the model, you and at the most 3 other photographers that help and assist each other.  There will be times for paparazzi shoots. Those are for promotional purposes.  

Models don't expect or request copies of the images. And photographers are not obligated to share.  Sure, if you happen to have a spectacular image feel free to post it for everyone to see.

You get what you pay for: TMD models are interviewed and if their portfolio is lacking, they are test shot.  

At TMD, the models are more than just models, they are business people, hospitable & creative. They understand that photographers are here to learn, experiment and have fun!

Direct from Los Angeles, California

Learn From REGGIE BROOKS...

The #1 Abandoned Property Authority in the Nation Reggie Brooks, the #1 abandoned property specialist in North America. Reggie is also an international speaker, author and educator, dedicated to inspiring others to achieve personal success through real estate investment. Having risen above a life of poverty, he has achieved what many people consider to be impossible. He went from making $36,000 per year at the local telephone company, to making over $40,000 per month in his real estate business. 

Starting out with very little money, Reggie began his investment career in 1986. After taking a few real estate investment courses, he began investing in rental properties in Los Angeles. He quickly replaced his telephone company income of $3,000 per month with over $4,200 per month from a few well-placed investments, becoming financially independent within his first year of investing.

Today, Reggie delivers his personal philosophies for success at major business venues and expositions throughout the United States. Reggie has also exploded as thee expert on "Abandoned Property Specialist" in the world.

Reggie attributes his success to faith and family, and to the invaluable mentors he has met along the way.

Of all his many accomplishments, Reggie is most proud of his family--his wife Ersoleen, and children Keith and Arlett.

with Investor & Educator Kevin Rollings.

Dr. Teresa R. Martin, Esq. is a sought-after attorney, real estate broker, real estate and financial health coach and certified personal and business credit consultant. As principal of her own practice, she has honed her skills in the areas of residential & commercial real estate transactions, foreclosure defense litigation and credit restoration services.


In addition to being an attorney, Teresa wears the hat of a seasoned real estate investor with a focus on creative acquisition strategies. Strategies that she developed, implemented and taught to others through her role as Counsel/Founder of Real Estate Investors Association NYC (“REIA NYC”) and as Director and past President of the New York Chapter of Better Investing, the nation’s largest non-profit organization dedicated to investment education.

She continues to use her God-given gifts to encourage, equip and help others understand sound financial biblical principles through Generational Wealth Zone, a conduit for the everyday person to achieve financial freedom through tutelage in the areas of financial literacy, business ownership, real estate and stock market investing.

Teresa has appeared as a legal and real estate expert on Voice of America, Real Estate Straight Talk and numerous radio programs. She has been featured in such publications as Money Magazine and Diva Zone Magazine and more.

Get Your Own 800+ Credit Score with Merrill Chandler, Founder of Credit Sense!

Learn how to optimize your credit and raise your credit score 45 points in 45 days while getting on the path to a Tier 1 or even 800+ credit score.


Learn how to raise your credit score 45 points in 45 days! Do you know what opportunities come with an 800+ credit score? THE CREDIT SENSE DIFFERENCE. CreditSense tackles the 800 pound gorilla of the credit system by helping consumers and business professionals to achieve Tier 1 or even 800+ credit scores. CreditSense offers powerful, proven strategies to not only recover lost points due to bad credit, but to optimize our clients' credit profiles so that every piece of data measured by FICO scoring software produces the maximum number of credit score points for them. In this presentation Merrill will show you how to optimize your credit and get you on the path to a Tier 1 or even 800+ credit score. About Credit Sense:

Every credit repair company in the country does the same thing. They send a letter to the credit bureaus that says the problem account is not yours, or not actually late. They have no proof or research behind what they say, kind of like pointing your finger in the dark. They give you a SINGLE POINT of credit inspection.

And what if you don't have bad credit but you still want a higher score?

At CreditSense we do things different. We know that there is a perfect credit profile that always delivers an 800+ credit score. (round hole) Your credit profile is probably NOT perfect (square peg). We bring your credit profile into alignment with that perfect profile. The result: YOU get a Tier 1 or even an 800+ credit score—guaranteed!

How do we do it? Instead of a one-point inspection, we do a 40-point inspection of every facet of your credit profile looking for factual errors, inconsistencies, and drags on your score—and we fix and optimize them! CreditSense does REAL research and checks what is dragging your score down, then has your creditors and the bureaus correct them.

bit.ly/gdg-devfest2015-cfp 

We've partnered with GDG NYC, GDG North Jersey, GDG Hudson Valley, WeWork and Google to host FireHack.  This is a weekend-long Hackathon at Google New York and WeWork, with a focus on Firebase and Google Cloud Platform as the back-end technologies and your choice of front-end tech.  

Speakers

Martin Omander, Google (Mountain View)

Program Manager for Development Platform

Martin is visiting us from the Google mother ship in Silicon Valley, and is program manager for Google Developer Groups in North America.  He also wears awesome hats.  Martin will welcome us to Google as well as serve as a mentor throughout the event. 

Bret McGowen, Google (NYC) 

Developer Advocate for Firebase and Google Cloud

Bret originally hails from the great state of Texas, and now serves as a Developer Advocate at Google NYC primarily in the areas of Firebase and Google Cloud Platform.  Bret will deliver his awesome "No Stack Development using Firebase" 101 session, which he recently delivered at the NYC Code Camp.  He'll also give a brief intro to Google Cloud Platform, including fundamentals and deployment. 

Elizabeth Padilla, Google (Mountain View) 

Program Manager, Development Platform

Liz works with Martin as a Program Manager for the Developer Platform at Google in Mountain View.  She's an expert in the areas of community development, social media, marketing and public speaking, and will help teams prepare for pitches.  

Jeffrey Posnick, Google (NYC)

Senior Developer Relations Engineer, Open Web Platform

Jeff works as a Dev Relations engineer on the Open Web Platform at Google NYC, and will delivery a quick intro to rapid web development using Polymer. 

For more details about the event, visit the dedicated site: 

http://firehack.splashthat.com/ 

We'll also have mentors on hand to help you on your projects, as well as free food, prizes for winners and giveaways.  

*Note that because of the large number of groups participating, we will have a limited number of slots for participants. 

For now, please RSVP and get on the wait list for the event if you are interested in attending and if chosen we will reach out to you to confirm your participation. 

* Full agenda and themes to come shortly.

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

results.description:
Our complete Fall 2015 Hike Schedule is now available on the NJR ADK website at hudsonhikers.org. If there's a hike you'd like to join that's not posted here on Meetup, you may register directly with the hike leader using the contact information provided in the hike schedule.

*   *   *   *   *   *

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:  Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.
results.name: Fall 2015 Hike Schedule

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Thank you to ALL who came to our first CS Pedagogy Meetup this past weekend! We had a great showing and will share with everyone the videos as they are ready. 

If you attended but have yet to fill out the survey, please do! Send me the confirmation page for $50 DonorsChoose.org credit! This is the meetup summary. 

Sean's talk is up on our Youtube page. The resources he mentions are here. You can also check out past talks on our channel.

For November, we have another amazing lineup for you. If you'd like to throw your hat in the ring, please fill out this presenter form

PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - We will start promptly @ 9:45am.

> Nathaniel Granor - The Four Steps To Solve Any Problem 
In 1945, mathematician George Pólya published "How To Solve It" a quirky small volume that meditates on the thought process of solving problems, particularly in the domain of Geometry. He presents 4 major steps of problem-solving along with specific strategies and heuristics to attempt to apply. He also reflects on the role of a teacher in helping students build problem solving skills.

This session will present Pólya's work reframed for the context of computer science and proposes the 4 Steps as a conceptual model for both students and teachers to reflect on their own problem solving processes.

Computer Science and computational thinking are very much about problem solving. Experienced computer scientists have an implicit toolkit of approaches they use when facing a new problem. New learners often lack that toolkit. Attendees will walk away from the workshop with an extensive set of Question Stems aligned to each of the 4 Steps that can immediately be put into practice in the classroom.

Nathaniel is Regional Manager at TEALS.

> Lionel Bergeron + Alana Aaron - Engaging All Learners in Computer Science
In 2013 Code.org initiated a worldwide interest in computer programming through the Hour of Code. In an effort to continue to engage students, especially in the elementary grades, they developed Computer Science Fundamentals. The courses blend online, self-guided and self-paced tutorials with “unplugged” activities that require no computers at all. This workshop will look at how these unplugged activities can be used to engage all learners, no matter what the age or academic level. In addition, we will explore how the curriculum’s Play Lab allows students to explore their own interest and ideas through creative programming. The most important takeaways from the presentation will be that participants will be able to identify how unplugged activities can enhance computer science content, how much the play factor can impact student performance and how to approach other lessons to engage all learners.

Alana is a 5th grade teacher in Washington Heights and Lionel is a Technology Coach for D75, NYC's Special Education District.

> Christine Keefe + Glenn Durfee - Using Parson's Problems to Teach AP CS
Parson's Problems ask students to put code statements in the correct order to solve a problem. They are a fun and efficient way to assess student learning of higher level learning objectives. They are "scrambled code puzzles", and consist of a complete sample of well-written code presented in a random order. When properly written, Parson's problems allow instructors to identify what students don't know in syntax and logic.

Attendees will learn the "hows" and "whys" of using Parson's-type problems in teaching and assessing AP Computer Science. Attendees will be able to: 1) Explain how a parsons problem can be used to tease apart errors in syntax, logic, or both, and 2) Demonstrate how to tier a parsons problem to accommodate for different learners.

Christine and Glenn are rockstar TEALS volunteers.

> Gordon Smith - Not so Standard: 5-9th Grade Coding Standards
As the CSTA begins their comprehensive review and revision of their K-12 CS Standards, we thought it was a good time to have a discussion about teaching CS in 5th to 9th grade.
Our vision is for standards that are specific enough to assess the efficacy of CS teaching and curriculum, yet at the same time broad enough to encompass coding, physical computing, and robotics. Well constructed standards will help ensure that we, as CS educators, are working towards common goals and have a framework for ensuring that we are preparing students for high school, college, career, and life-long learning opportunities in CS.

We will discuss the existing CSTA standards and the standards we are developing to guide our curriculum at Codesters. We will also facilitate an open discussion among participants to help broaden and deepen a common set of standards and how to use standards to guide teaching pedagogy and assessment. The participant discussion will focus on how to make appropriate grade-level standards that prepare students for high school level standards (i.e. APCSP) and beyond. We will also discuss the purpose of CS education and how that defines what success means for students. Participants will also learn what standards are currently being used in middle grades and gain insight on selecting standards for their classroom. Attendees will also have the opportunity to share their own expertise about what belongs in a comprehensive set of standards for CS in the middle grades.

Gordon is the founder of Codesters.
results.name: CS Pedagogy Meetup - Nov 2015 Edition

results.description:
LEADER:  Daphne Downes ([masked] or[masked])

RATING:  B 6.5 B+

Meet 9:30 AM Rt 17A Park & Ride (see link above for directions) for carpool to trail head (where parking is limited) for a figure-eight hike with rocky ridge lines and beautiful views, past Bald Rocks Shelter, Hogencamp mines and through “Times Square”. We’ll take the RD, Dunning, and Long Path trails, then return via the RD, Dunning, White Bar and Nurian trails. Steady rain cancels. Please notify leader in advance if arriving on 9:19 AM bus. Optional lunch in Sloatsburg after the hike. TC Northern Harriman map 119.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B-7-A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

NO SHOW/LATE CANCELLATION POLICY:
Please be considerate of event hosts/organizers and others who may want to attend an event by not being a "NO SHOW" (failing to show up when you've RSVP'd "yes") or a "LATE CANCEL" (changing RSVP to a "no" within 24 hours of an event).  If you have a history of No Shows and/or Late Cancels, we may have to bump you to the waiting list for meetups with limited space, in favor of those with a positive attendance history.
results.name: Bald Rocks/Hogencamp Mountain

results.description:
SO MANY OF US HAVE HIKED OUT TO GERTRUDE'S NOSE BUT WHO HAS EVER BEEN DARING OR ADVENTUROUS ENOUGH TO EXPLORE WHAT LAYS BENEATH IN "GERTRUDE'S NASAL PASSAGEWAYS"?

Please Note: Even though the actual hiking portion of this adventure is not that difficult the crevice exploration will be more challenging requiring athleticism, good balance and the ability to be in control of your body. This hike is recommended for those that enjoy ROCK SCRAMBLING. Once we reach Gertrude's Nose there will be a focus on the exploration of the crevices beneath.  Anyone interested in this hike that does not want to participate in the crevice exploration must be prepared to self lead themselves back from Gertrude's Nose and must also leave a 5-star rating since they have been fore-warned! You can't complain if you fail to read the description.  Whew! - Glad that's out of the way...now on to the description:

Arguably the most picturesque vista in the Shawangunks, Gertrude’s Nose is a geologic snapshot of the destructive natural forces that are slowly ripping apart the Shawangunk conglomerate and leaving behind some of its most intriguing features. The cliff’s name stems from a 1682 deed giving land to Gertrude Bruyn, a settler of Dutch descent.

Our hike will traverse miles of stunning views and fascinating geological formations including Gertrude’s Nose, a great wedge-like mass of conglomerate cliff. Gertrude’s Nose looks like the prow of a great ship, with massive blocks of fallen rock below.  From the peak, you have stunning views of The Catskill Mountains to the north and the Hudson Valley to the east.

But the fun does not stop there!  Rather then walking right over the surface of this natural beauty we will get down and dirty doing whatever it takes to reach the bottom and fully explore the numerous crevices interlaced throughout Gertrude's Nose. (That's right folks - I'm bringing the webbing!)

Finally we will complete our hike through dense hemlock forest and over streams as we marvel at the crags and crevasses of the Shawangunk Ridge.

WHERE TO MEET?

WE WILL START AT THE UPPER PARKING AREA ADJACENT TO LAKE MINNEWASKA ALL THE WAY UP THE HILL AFTER PASSING THROUGH THE MAIN ENTRANCE GATE.

Distance:  approx 8 miles

Hiking Pace:  Up to 2.0 mph - In the Crevices it will be Slow but physically challenging

Estimated Hike Time:  7 hours

Difficulty:  Advanced Beginner/Intermediate - Rocky Terrain and Crevices with possible exposures - I will bring a 50 ft. handline to help navigate any hard terrain.

Current Weather Forecast: Cloudy with a high of 61 Degrees 

Fee: $10. per car

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Raincoat/Windbreaker

• Hiking Poles (if desired)

• "Scrambling" Gloves - Lightweight with good grip - Gardening gloves from Home Depot work great!

• Shoes with good grip - preferably with ankle support

• Headlamp with spare batteries - Home Depot has a great 100 lumen headlamp for only $12.99!

• A Small Pack - nothing too large that will become a hindrance in the scrambles

• Related maps, a Compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, etc.

RELATED MAPS:

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference - Shawangunk Trails Map Set

Afterwards feel free to join us at Bacchus Restaurant, Bar & Billiards for some great food/drinks & maybe even a game of Pool! (Venue subject to change based on group interest)

Contact Information:

Bacchus Restaurant

4 South Chestnut Street

New Paltz, NY 12561

Phone: (845)[masked]

Website: http://www.bacchusnewpaltz.com/index

Hours:

Lunch: 11am – 4:30pm

Dinner: 4:30pm – 10pm

Brunch: 10am – 3pm (Sat & Sun only)

Late Night Appetizer Menu Closes:

Sun – Wed @ 11pm | Thurs – Sat @ 1am



**HEAVY RAIN WILL CANCEL THIS EVENT**


NYC HIKING & OUTDOOR ADVENTURE GROUP LEGAL DISCLAIMER

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

The NYC Hiking & Outdoor Adventure Group does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers.

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
