results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya

venue.name: Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine

results.description:
Join us on Nov. 7th, 2015 when Adventures in Photography visits the Cathedral Church of St. John the Divine to photograph this iconic structure which is the fourth largest Christian Church in the world.

AIP has arranged for private access to this site. The entire space will be open and accessible to our group including the triforium level in the main hall. (There is about a 50 stair climb to the triforium.)

Our group will be allowed to use tripods and/or monopods. However, we need to collapse them on our climb to the triforium.


We are limiting the size of the group to 12 photographers plus AIP Organizers to maximize our photo ops and avoid having other photographers in our line of sight.

The Cathedral of St. John the Devine, is the cathedral of the Episcopal Diocese of New York. It is located on Amsterdam Avenue between West 110th Street and 113th Street in Manhattan's Morningside Heights.

The Cathedral was designed in 1888 and construction began in 1892. It remains unfinished, with construction and restoration a continuing process.

The following images of the interior of the Cathedral will give you an idea of what you'll find to photograph on Nov. 7th, 2015

_________________________________________

We hope you'll be able to join us.

Martin Joffe, Eric Dong, Boris Hardouin, Shiv Verma

Your AIP Organizer

results.description:
Hola amigas y amigos!

Join us for the movie Captain Pantoja (and the special services)! It will be an  afternoon of fun, entertainment and mucho, mucho español.

This movie was based on the comedic novel Captain Pantoja and the Special Service (Spanish: Pantaleón y las visitadoras) by Nobel Laureate writer from Peru Mario Vargas Llosa. The Peruvian army captain Pantaleon Pantoja, a very serious and efficient officer, is chosen by his superiors to set up a special service of 'visitors' to satisfy the special needs of the soldiers posted on remote jungle outposts. He uses his remarkable organizational skills in action and in a short time has his female squad running smoothly.

 The Los Angeles Times called Captain Pantoja "A sure-fire mix of sex and satire". 

IN SPANISH, WITH ENGLISH SUBTITLES - SUITABLE FOR ALL LEVELS

REFRESEHMENTS WILL BE SERVED!!!

WHERE

At EASY ESPANOL, located on the 11th floor (address is at the top). Can't miss it.

EVENT SCHEDULE

Saturday, November 7th, 2015

5:30 pm: Door opens, arrive in venue. Meet others and practice your Spanish!

5:40 pm: A brief intro to the movie

5:45 pm: Movie starts!

7:20 pm: Movie ends

7:20 - 7:30 pm: Short discussion afterwards

ABOUT THE FILM

Captain Pantoja and the Special Services (2000) "Pantaleón y las visitadoras" (original title) R, 137 min, Comedy, Drama, 27 September 2002 (USA)  7.2  / 10 Rating.

Director: Francisco J. Lombardi

Writers: Enrique Moncloa, Giovanna Pollarolo, 1 more credit »

Stars: Angie Cepeda, Salvador del Solar, Mónica Sánchez

COST

Just $6 online or  $10 at event (if space is available)

SPACE IS LIMITED; PLEASE PAY ONLINE IN ADVANCE TO SECURE (RESERVE) A SPOT. RSVPs without payment DO NOT reserve seats.

Advance payment will guarantee (reserve) a spot. You can also pay cash $10 at event if space is available.

No PayPal? No credit card? No problem. Please read ---> HERE

Read about Payment Confirmations ---> HERE

IMPORTANT NOTES
1) CANCELLATIONS/Event changes: Read ---> HERE
2) Please turn off your cell phone/beeper when movie starts
3) NO NEED TO BRING A PRINTED COPY of your online payment - But it might help if you do. Anyone who paid online will be in a list at the door under his/her paypal accountholder name or the name on the credit card (whichever was used to pay)

Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Chanting is used ancient cultures all over the world as a way of celebration.  The chanting that we do on Bhakti Nite is based in Sanskrit chants, which have a vibrational effect on the heart and mind.  If you enjoy music, meditation or just meeting new people come try it out.  The chants are simple and are repeated over and over so that anyone can join in, no knowledge of Sanskrit is necessary.

Cost: None, donations are happily accepted.

Bring yourself and a friend if you wish!

group.name: "Art of Living" NYC- Making Life a Celebration

results.description:
The Light The Night Walk is a fundraising campaign benefiting The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) and their funding of research to find blood cancer cures. 

This wonderful organization needs volunteers to help along the walk route in Rye, NY.  Volunteers will be directing walkers through our “Hall of Heroes” and “Section of Silence” sections of the walk and ensuring these sections remain properly set up throughout the duration of the walk.  We will also be cheering and directing walkers along the walk route and handing out "mission moments" at the Finish Line.  We need MANY enthusiastic volunteers in this area from 5:30pm-8:30pm!

*Note* - This event has numerous other volunteer opportunities starting around 3:30pm...if you would like to volunteer in a different area prior to the route activies, please feel free to contact me directly.  I will be there earlier helping out.  =)

* Please add +1's to your RSVP if you are bringing kids! 


The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society's Light The Night® Walk funds research to find cures and ensure access to treatments for all blood cancer patients.  More info can be found here:   http://www.lightthenight.org/
results.how_to_find_us: When you arrive you will check in at the volunteer check-in table
results.name: Walk route volunteers for Light The Night® Walk (kids welcome)

results.description:
Today we will be focused and immersive in a  specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we will focus on drawing characters or machines from the futuritic Victorian world of Steampunk.

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also if you'd like to share any art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them.

Also if you'd like to share anything such as art or reference books with the group relating to the theme I urge you to bring them!

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!
results.name: Lets Draw! Theme: Steampunk

results.description:
100 RSVP's across Meetup and Facebook platforms! 

Our last event was truly special! We filled up the space with lovely singles ready to mix & mingle! 

How would you like to go on 20+ micro dates in one night? Oh, the possibilities! Spend your evening with me while I guide you through each round of dates. 

Speed Dating seats sell out quickly  - Preregister via Paypal today to ensure your seat is reserved by visiting

</a><a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E
<a href="https://littlegaybook.com/events/lesbian-speed-datingnetworking-2/"></a>

Our last event sold out fast! And now I have a long wait-list for speed dating. Sign up today, you won't regret it! (There is no selling out for mingling, only speed dating seats)

ATTENTION:  Speed Dating rounds start at 7pm SHARP!  Arrive no later than 6:30 to receive your materials. 

Join Melissa and meet some of NYC & NJ’s most eligible single women for speed dating and networking! Would you rather make friends instead? Come join the fun – there is no pressure. Make romantic, friendship, and even business connections. You can speed-date, speed-friend, or speed network!  


$20 if you preregister for a speed dating seat or 
$25 to sign up at the door (both includes entrance to our singles mixer)

and we provide you with everything you need including pen, clip board, score card and optional questions! 

$7.00 Specialty Cocktails Specials! 
$7.00 Beer!! 
$25.00 Hookah!!! 
Yummy Tapas Menu!!!! 

It’s okay if you’re feeling nervous about speed dating because I will guide you from start to finish and give you all the tools you need to succeed! 

</a>

<a href="https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=LWZGN3X2EER9E">Preregister now by clicking here!

*This is not just a speed dating event - This is a singles mixer too!!*

$5.00 cover to attend mixer only 
6pm - 10pm

Don't want to speed date but still want to have fun? Join us at our singles mixer where we will drop our inhibitions and go out on a limb for love! While the women are speed dating, you can mingle with one another and see what all the speed dating fuss is about! I will be there to help break the ice and make introductions. You never know who you'll meet! Once speed dating rounds are done, we ALL GET TO PARTY TOGETHER and dance the night away! 

If you're nervous about attending a singles event, don't be! Fearless women from all spectrum of the rainbow attend my events and make fun, quality connections - Why Not You?! 


Let's dance the evening away and make lasting connections at this beautiful space tailored for a sexy and grown FUN time! 

How it works:


• Rounds will last approximately 3-5 minutes depending upon the number of participants.
• Scorecards and assigned numbers will be handed out to all speed dating participants. In addition, suggested questions  will be provided to help the tongue-tied and we encourage you to ask your own! Be creative with your questions and more importantly HAVE FUN!
• At the end of the event submit your scorecards to Melissa. She solely will review scorecards. 100% private & confidential! Client privacy is of top concern. When two singles indicate the same level of interest toward each other (2nd date, friendship, business), we will provide each with the other’s contact information via email.

and Voila! 

This event is being cross-promoted over several meetup groups and all over Facebook. The RSVP represented here is NOT indicative of actual participation!

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Dear holistic friend:

There are over 1800 holistic members in both of my Meet Ups, Holistic Living on Long Island and in The Wellness and Entrepreneurs Exchange. How cool is that?


Here is another cool thing... I am thinking HOLIDAY SEASON is just around the corner.

As such, I am inviting you to a beautiful Share Your Holistic Products and Services Networking event! This is to take place at Graphic Eye Art Gallery, 402 Main Street, Port Washington, from 6pm to 8:30pm on Saturday, November 7th. The Art Gallery is right across from Inspiration Wharf. Park at the Town Dock or at the Wharf.

Share your products and services with us at our Sharing Circle which will begin promptly at 6:15pm! Thank you for arriving at 6pm.

Tell us what you do and why you are passionate about what you do. Ask for referrals and give referrals. Bring sample products and gift certificates as we are nearing holiday season!

I personally am excited to share my Eucalyptus,  Healthy, Luxurious, Sustainable, Living Fresh Collection bedding products (Sheet Sets, Pillows, Duvets, Blankets, Towels, etc.) with you. They are hypoallergenic, antimicrobial and just beautiful. Great for everyone, but particularly helpful to those with allergies, asthma, night sweats and skin conditions.

I am also excited that my VP of Business Development and Life Coach, Randi Farina will be presenting to us about the LFC products and opportunity. Randi will also be presenting on The Importance of Goal Setting, and also What Holds People Back from Living the Lives of Their Dreams. She will be available for mini- individual consults on the this topic!

I spent three days with Randi at an amazing LFC conference in Fort Lauderdale recently. I was incredibly impressed with her as a person (most important) and as a business woman. The one thing (of many) that left a lasting impression on me was the fact that Randi did a whole Powerpoint presentation  on The Importance of Being Vulnerable. She is beautiful, charasmatic, very skilled, and most importantly, very authentic.

Healthy drinks and refreshments served. 
  I look forward to a beautiful evening with you on Saturday, November 7th. I've decided to offer this event FOR FREE providing you rsvp by Thursday, November 5th. 

After November 5th, $25. Thank you very much for rsvping on this site and also by emailing me at [masked] by Thursday, Nov. 5! Having accurate numbers of attendees is so important for event planners!

Let me know via email what products and/or services you wish to represent. Invite friends and relatives!

Bring your products, share your services and let's create a great holiday season!!

With warmest wishes,

Carol Leitner, MBA, Health Care Administration

Marketer, Holistic Health Products and Services

Health Expo and Events Planner

Sleep Consultant, Living Fresh Collection

Sales Coordinator, Juice Plus+ (30 Whole Food Concentrated Fruits, Vegetables and Berries)

Certified Kripalu Yoga Instructor and Thai Yoga Body worker
results.how_to_find_us: I, Carol will be welcoming you at the door.

Park at the Town Dock or at the Wharf.

Share your products and services with us at our Sharing Circle which will begin promptly at 6:15pm! Thank you for arriving at 6pm.

Tell us what you do and why you are passionate about what you do. Ask for referrals and give referrals. Bring sample products and gift certificates as we are nearing holiday season!

I personally am excited to share my Eucalyptus,  Healthy, Luxurious, Sustainable, Living Fresh Collection bedding products (Sheet Sets, Pillows, Duvets, Blankets, Towels, etc.) with you. They are hypoallergenic, antimicrobial and just beautiful. Great for everyone, but particularly helpful to those with allergies, asthma, night sweats and skin conditions.

I am also excited that my VP of Business Development and Life Coach, Randi Farina will be presenting to us about the LFC products and opportunity. Randi will also be presenting on The Importance of Goal Setting, and also What Holds People Back from Living the Lives of Their Dreams. She will be available for mini- individual consults on this topic!

I spent three days with Randi at an amazing LFC conference in Fort Lauderdale recently. I was incredibly impressed with her as a person (most important) and as a business woman. The one thing (of many) that left a lasting impression on me was the fact that Randi did a whole Powerpoint presentation  on The Importance of Being Vulnerable. She is beautiful, charasmatic, very skilled, and most importantly, very authentic.

Healthy drinks and refreshments served. 
  I look forward to a beautiful evening with you on Saturday, November 7th. I've decided to offer this event FOR FREE providing you rsvp by Thursday, November 5th. 

After November 5th, $25. Thank you very much for rsvping on this site and also by emailing me at [masked] by Thursday, Nov. 5! Having accurate numbers of attendees is so important for event planners!

Let me know via email what products and/or services you wish to represent. Invite friends and relatives!

Bring your products, share your services and let's create a great holiday season!!

With warmest wishes,

Carol Leitner, MBA, Health Care Administration

Marketer, Holistic Health Products and Services

Health Expo and Events Planner

Sleep Consultant, Living Fresh Collection

Sales Coordinator, Juice Plus+ (30 Whole Food Concentrated Fruits, Vegetables and Berries)

Certified Kripalu Yoga Instructor and Thai Yoga Body worker

results.description:
This event is being hosted by The New York Social Network and their partner groups.  The number of RSVP's from this Meet Up represents only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions contact the event host Dave Cervini at [masked].

The New York Social Network is the only social/networking group to offer a Bartending/Mixology  class where you get to go behind an actual bar and mix drinks with the real stuff!  Belly up to the bar with a small group of NYSN members and friends and learn how to make your favorite drinks in a fun and casual setting.  Your professional instructor will teach you regular mixed drinks, cosmo’s, martini’s, frozen drinks and specialty shots!  You will get to sample all that you make!!!

You will also learn a few tricks, hear some strange stories and you will take home your drink recipes with a guideline to how to stock you home bar!  Mixology Class is limited to 10 people and is one of our most popular events!  Don’t miss out!

Hot and cold appetizers are served.

Following the class, stay for our New Members Welcome Party for FREE!


Can I come alone?  Yes, 99% of those taking the class will likely sign up on their own.  The best part is that you are invited to stay for the New Members Party at the World Bar following the class and you will already have a dozen new friends.! 

What to wear: business casual/ clubby

This event is being hosted by The New York Social Network WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP’s below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending. (We have a 3 flakes and you’re out rule). If you have any questions regarding this or any of our events please contact Dave Cervini directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Fun Bartending & Mixology Class & Party

results.description:
Small-town businessman, pastor and volunteer firefighter Todd Burpo (Greg Kinnear) and his wife, Sonja (Kelly Reilly), are struggling to make ends meet during a tough year. After their young son, Colton (Connor Corum), undergoes emergency surgery, Todd and Sonja are overjoyed at the child's miraculous recovery. However, the Burpos are unprepared for what happens next -- Colton says that he went to heaven and back, and tells his parents things that he couldn't possibly know.

After the movie, we will have a short discussion on what The Bible says about what happens when we die.

Note: Vegan/Gluten-free Snack bar available at the venue.

results.description:
Find Your Healing Path

 Every one of us is on this Earth to make a specific contribution or to fulfill a certain task. When we discover – or remember – our own spiritual identity, we acquire the ability to both heal ourselves and to contribute to the healing of the world as a whole.

 In this class you will learn one way to explore your spiritual destiny. Shaman Eric Goldman will discuss how spirit led him to the study of shamanism in general and to the Hawaiian tradition of the kahuna lapau’ au’ in particular. Eric will lead you through a shamanic meditation, or journey, and then use his skills as a “healer with words” to help you collaborate with spirit in the discovery of your personal path as a healer.

suggested donation of $20

results.description:
Join us for the opening reception of "Statue of Everything," an exhibit by Mira Gáberová at Open Source Gallery.

"Statue of Everything" will be on view at Open Source from November 7-30.

A stage curtain is a peculiar form of a barrier. It is the barrier between our ordinary and mundane world and an anticipated event of the virtual world of theatre. At the same time it divides the space with a passive position of the viewer from the space of the stage where the artistic process takes place. The curtain conceals, divides and determines the space. In many instances we perceive it as a two-dimensional blind that obstructs vision, not different from a sleepy screen of a computer or closed eyes.

Contemporary artists, just like their performative activities, often oscillate on the borderline between the mundane world around them and an artificially determined field of creative process. One of many possible ways how to define this is to use a medium of video. Mira Gáberová uses video especially in this sense. In many of her works, like in the presented one, the video frame reflects the space of artist`s passive presence confronted with a given environment, rather than a theatre stage for an active performance.

Here an analogy between the theatre space and artist`s activities is fully expressed by the author. The particular videos capture the artists performing on the proscenium of various theatres. She stands exactly on the imaginary borderline where the stage curtain opens or closes or is lowered and raised. The artist is in a literal physical contact with the curtain in these situations. A minimalist straightforwardness of the performance itself is contrasted by pathos of theatre environment. Mira Gáberová might at first glance present her body as an object, but standing on the borderline of the stage and auditorium proves how important the value of own experience is to her.

The stage curtain is a three-dimensional actor as well as a spatial object. Simultaneously, it serves as a metaphor for a relationship between an artist and reality, where the intersection between the ordinary and the imagination becomes the matter of physicality.

Mira Gáberová (born 1979 in Lučenec, Slovakia ) lives and works in Prague, Czech Republic. She obtained her BFA from the Academy of Fine Arts and Design in Bratislava and her MFA from the University of Newcastle. She has had residencies at the Museum Quartier, Donumenta Regensburg, and the ISCP. Gaberova has exhibited at the Pradelna Bohnice (Czech Republic), Umelka Gallery (Slovakia), Approach Art Association (Hungary), and Oi Futuro (Brazil) among others.

Text by Viktor Čech. Čech is a curator, art historian, and professor at Charles University in Prague.
results.name: OPENING RECEPTION: Mira Gáberová's "Statue of Everything"

Hi Friends,  Frank's performance is coming up fast!  If you haven't purchased your ticket I suggest you do it soon.  There will only be 10 tickets available at the door.  Don't get left out in the cold!

Meet for a drink at Vino Levantino (Broadway & 94th) at 5:30pm, or just head over to the church on your own.  The choice is yours!

The program includes the music of W.C. Handy, Antonio Carlos Jobim, Thelonius Monk and Frank Ponzio, as well as some classic Gospel Songs.

results.description:
So...How Does Confidence Work? The perfect meetup for people who wish they could sing out in public, perform with more ease, or those who have struggled with public speaking and sharing their artistic talents and passions. If tips, tricks, and advice hasn't made a lasting impact thus far, this meetup is for you! My mentor, Advanced Transformative Coach & Founder of Divine Play, Jeanne Catherine will be giving a free public talk exploring the art + science behind being human and the truth of how to go about feeling more confident. We will be web conferencing in with a group of local artists in Charlottesville and spend an hour exploring confidence, before our open mic starts up!

This will be a special event, for sure!
As always, the intention here is to create a safe, non-judgmental space. You do not have to have any previous understanding of psychology, philosophy, music theory, or neuroscience to attend. All that is required is an open mind and open heart. If you have any questions, please email me at: [masked]
results.name: How to Build Confidence: A Free Public Talk

group.name: NYC Area: Making Music (+ Life) Fun Again

If your in town this weekend you can join us for this no cover event where we will enjoy awesome tropical drinks and live music!

Otto's is a new interpretation of the Tiki Bar, mixing traditional Tiki decor and potent rum based concoctions with live bands and DJs resulting in NYC's premier Rock-n-Roll Tiki joint.

Come network from 7:15 to 8PM and after 8 we will go to the back and enjoy a variety of great live music!

Tropical drinks to choose from

results.description:
Hello to all fellow food adventurers : )

Have always wanted to try Haitian food so here goes.....let us dine at the acclaimed Haitian restaurant La Caye in Brooklyn. We will dine individual style with everyone paying for their own food/drink + tax+ tips. Please carry cash as it makes things easier.

Looking forward to great food/conversation and pleasant evening with the amazing people I always meet in this group.

Menu link http://www.lacayebk.com/#!menu/c24tf

Award Winning Lanbi Boukannen/ Lambi Boucané sounds so good !

La Caye brings authentic Haitian cuisine to the heart of Fort Greene, Brooklyn. Its signature flavors hailing from lime, tomato, thyme and habañero, Haitian cuisine is flavorful, aromatic and healthy.


"At twilight, broiled conch with Creole sauce and black rice superimposes Caribbean warmth on the “new” Brooklyn." Steve Cuozzo, New York Post

"Best conch in New York!" - Village Voice
results.name: Haitian dinner@La Caye, Brooklyn

group.name: ! New York Ethnic Food Lovers and activities

results.description:
Hi All, 
Back by popular demand we have yet another fun place for a social/comedy night Meetup. This one is located in Berkeley Heights, NJ which is a cool and causal, comedy night cafe. They serve coffee, sandwiches, and desserts. It is also byob permissible.


Headliner: Mark Riccadonna- Fox Laugh TV, AXS TV's Gotham Comedy Live

Mark Riccadonna grew up an artsy jock outside of Youngstown, Ohio. At age 17 (like a bad independent movie), Mark moved to NYC in search of himself and happiness. He pursued Theatre at The American Academy of Dramatic Arts, joining "The Company" after graduation. Soon after, Mark stumbled upon Stand-Up Comedy and found success as a storyteller, performing throughout New York City, and 'on the road'. Mark currently also performs for Armed Forces Entertainment, and has entertained U.S. and U.N. Troops worldwide, performing in six continents while working with his childhood heroes.

Whether he is working with The Amoralists Theatre Company (In the acclaimed hit "Happy in the Poor House"), Angry Shih Tzu Productions or on tour with Stand-Up, Mark continues to climb the ranks. He is a gifted storyteller, with a charisma that makes you feel like you’ve known him forever, unique delivery, signature voice (that has landed him several commercials) and likability; you will see why he is a favorite at clubs and theatres everywhere.

Mark Tours regularly with Armed Forces Entertainment. Just returned from opening on The Monsters of Rock Cruise. Been seen on MTV, Food Network, NBC, SPIKE and Speed network as well as worked on the projects- "The Boom", "The Devil's Tree", "The Days of Power" and "Game Night".

Host: Adam Lucidi - AXS TV's Gotham Comedy Live
Adam Lucidi has been performing all over the country and brings a sarcastic and sometimes nostalgic view of his life and the world around him. Making his television debut on Gotham Comedy Live on AXS TV and being featured in Time Out New York, Adam continues to leave a dent in the world of comedy. Whether he’s talking about his small town, being a “buckist”, or his common sense fighting against booksmarts, Adam brings his “boy next door charm with a sharptongue,” to various venues all over the country! If he’s performing at colleges, comedy clubs, or benefits across the country, two things are guaranteed, he’ll leave audiences wanting more and he’ll always be wearing that backwards hat.

Features: 

Ritu Chandra
Major NYC Clubs

Lazy housewife turned comedian. sometimes I love my husband, sometimes my son, sometimes my dog....rarely do i love all three simultaneously.

KP Burke
Jacksonville Comedy Festival

KP Burke is originally from New Jersey but from the sound of him you might not know it:

"I was stationed in Jacksonville, Florida with the Navy for six years," explained the comic. "I lost some of my accent down there so now I'm too 'Southern' for Jersey but still too 'Jersey' to be a southerner. I don't fit in anywhere. I have weatherman's accent now."

Also performing, Rocco Romeo- Stand Up NY

Central Jersey's hottest comedy show, located inside Mara's Cafe, Berkeley Heights NJ. Don't miss the funniest comedians in the area. Easy to get to.. Free parking.. 2 Item Minimum.

Tickets $20 at door, or &15 online here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/comedy-madness-maras-tickets-18998029618
results.name: Mad Laughs at Mara's

results.description:
The ability to develop rapport and connection is one of the key skills that will help you attract and keep the right people in your life. It's especially important if you are looking for a serious relationship or a long-term partner.

At this talk I will go over topics like:

-Vulnerability and opening up

-The role of rapport in seduction, and

-How to connect with someone even if you don't have a lot in common

We'll also have time for a discussion and questions

Cap 21 Studios

18 West 18th Street

Room 610

(Go to 6th floor, and it will have 10 on the door)

See you there!

Justin

http://JustinAttraction.com
results.how_to_find_us: Room 610
results.name: Developing Rapport and Connection: Free Talk

results.description:
Geoff Kubit will call a lively program of contras accompanied by King Kontra!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller.  No partner or experience required.  All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID.  Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us.  They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.how_to_find_us: Take the ACE, 1,2,3, L or F train to 14th St. We are on the northwest corner of 13th Street and 7th Avenue. Street address is 201 W. 13th.
results.name: Contra Dance with Geoff Cubit and King Kontra!

results.description:
Looking to meet new people in a friendly and casual environment? Join us for this private multi-group social for all new and existing members.

Forget about overcrowded bars, long lines to get in and people with attitudes. This will be one of the most friendliest and social Meetups you'll experience!

We will have our staff there to welcome all members and help introduce you to each other.  It's fun and laid back event that creates the perfect opportunity to make new friends.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT DOOR) -

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Nov-07-2015_at_0800PM

What to expect:

• Complimentary Hot & Cold Appetizers (8-9pm)

• Drink Specials (8-9pm)

• Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

• Socialize, Network & Connect With Other Members

PREPAY ONLY ($10 - Price goes to $15 as event gets closer) - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Nov-07-2015_at_0800PM

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own.

How many people attend? This is a multi-Meetup group event and we'll have 75+ members attending. 

Is this age/ethnic specific? No. We'll have a wide range of ages attending. All are welcome 21+. 

What's venue like? The World Bar is an upscale lounge with lots of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

What do I wear? Neat casual.

How do I get there? Take any east side line (4,5,6) trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st St. Then short walk towards the East River.

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Nov-07-2015_at_0800PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private for members and their guests - optional name tags will be provided
results.name: Private Member Saturday Night Social (Comp Apps, Drink Specials) Prepay Only

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Nov 28 Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$10 in advance only

Prepay here: http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.
results.name: Private Member Multi Group Social at World Bar - OVER 50 PREPAID

Hey Ladies,

I have been to Tao several times and enjoyed it each time.  This is located in the meatpacking district.  The place is a restaurant and there is a nightclub downstairs.  The food is incredible and the atmosphere is unreal. There bathroom even has a bar in it! I was thinking having dinner first and then once were finished do a little dancing/drinks in their nightclub!

Hope to see you ladies there!

http://taodowntown.com

Rosie

FYI- Dress code- no jeans, sneakers, baseball caps
results.name: Dinner & Dancing at Tao Downtown!

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.
results.name: Music Open Jam @ Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
Why not practise Japanese by singing karaoke? Let's get together on Saturday November 7th for a karaoke meetup! Sing! Practise Japanese conversation! Make new friends!

We'll meet at 8pm at Duet 35 on 35th Street (a few blocks north of Koreatown). We've reserved a 8-person karaoke room so space is limited, if you RSVP and can't make it please cancel your RSVP so someone else has a chance to sign up. Including tax and tip, the cost is $11 per hour per person, plus any drinks you order for yourself. We've booked the room for 3 hours. Please remember to bring your ID so that you will be able to order drinks. And please try and arrive on time! Arriving early means more chances to sing!

今回の会は久しぶりにカラオケにしましょう！カラオケをしながら、会話の練習をして新しい友達を作りましょう！場所はコリアンタウンの直ぐ近くの３５丁目と６番街にあるディエット３５というカラオケ店です。チップと税金込みで参加費用は一人１時間＄１１＋お酒になります。お酒を注文するために身分証明書（運転免許やパスポートなど）が必要です。人数の限定になりますので早く申し込んでください！
results.how_to_find_us: Ask at the entrance for the 8-person room booked by Ben

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Nov 28 Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$10 in advance only

Prepay here: http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.
results.name: Private Member Social Happy Hour at World Bar

results.description:
Postponing Round Round Three!!  Instead: Let's meet at Funkadelic Studio's Jam Session.  (Pictured: One of Funkadalic's 10 studios)


I am not charging for this meetup.  However, Funkadelic charges $10 at the door. 


The purpose of this meetup is the same: to support the process of getting bands started.  I am on a mission to meet everyone who joined "Starting A Great Band", assess everyone's skills, start to create bands with people who want to be in a band and start working toward playing out after a period of rehearsals. 


Here's what we're looking for:

1. Jazz Fusion - Jazz infused mix of musical styling in a Jam Band format.  5 Members: Guitar, Bass, Drums, Keys, Lead Vox (guitar and drums filled)
2. Classic Rock Band - 4 members: Guitar, Bass, Drums, Keys, Lead Vox
3. Folk Band - 4 members; Lead Guitar, Rhythm Guitar, Bass, Violin/Viola (+ if you sing)
4. Blues Band -  7 Members: Guitar/Vox, Guitar/Vox, Bass, Drums, Keys, Trumpet, Sax  
5. Alternative/Metal/Punk Band - 4 Members: Guitar, Bass, Drums, Vox
6. Easy Listening/Country - 6 Members: Guitar/vox, Bass, Drums,Keys, Violin, Lap Steel.


Bring your instrument. All instruments welcome.

NOTE:  This meetup REPLACES the previously scheduled meetup at Replay Studios for November 7th.  If you had paid the $12.00 for that meetup, you will receive a refund.
results.name: Let's Jam At Funkadelic Studios

results.description:
Please note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and 7 of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions about this event .  Please contact the event host Dave Cervini directly at [masked]


The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

Why does the event organizer have +40 for his RSVP's? That is because there are 8 Meetup.com groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com promoting this event.  There will be many more people than what you see below attending.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.

General Admission is $5.00.  Please bring exact change to the door.

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

(NYSN) have  been planning events in and around the city for busy professionals!  There are so many events to choose from, sometimes it is hard to figure out what is best especially if you have never been out.  If you are new to the groups or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. -lot's of room to sit, stand , socialize, network and connect

-60-80 members

Can I come alone? Yes 98% of those attending usually come on their own.

Dress: club, lounge, neat

General Admission is $5.00.  Pay at door for the first 50. Then $10


How do I get there? The World Bar is located on the ground floor of the World Tower on the corner of 1st ave and east 48th.  The 51st and 42nd street subways are closest then a few blocks walk. 

How long does it last? The crowds usuall stay till midnight.  The best time to get there is between 8-10pm

THIS EVENT IS BEING SPONSORED BY SEVERAL MEET UP GROUPS AND WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM. THE NUMBER OF RSVP'S BELOW REFLECT ONLY A PORTION OF THOSE ATTENDING.

WE APPRECIATE SERIOUS RSVP'S ONLY! If you can not make the event, please do not RSVP.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule! If you have questions about this or other www.newyorksocialnetwork.com events, please email: [masked] or call[masked]

results.name: Private Member Saturday Night Social (Comp Apps, Drink Specials) Prepay Only

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

All ATWYS members who pay in advance for this event will receive a promo code for $7 off a speeddating event as well as $5 off our Nov 28 Mix & Mingle Happy Hour. Please be sure to check your eventbrite order confirmation for the promo codes to use to redeem your discount.

$10 in advance only

Prepay here: http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.
results.name: Private Member Happy Hour - Ages 21-50

results.name: Private Member Saturday Night Social (Comp Apps, Drink Specials) Prepay Only

results.description:
Please note:  This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and 7 of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions about this event .  Please contact the event host Dave Cervini directly at [masked]

The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

Why does the event organizer have +40 for his RSVP's? That is because there are 8 Meetup.com groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com promoting this event.  There will be many more people than what you see below attending.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go? We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.

General Admission is $5.00.  Please bring exact change to the door.

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.name: Private Member Saturday Night Social (Comp Apps, Drink Specials) Prepay Only

results.description:
Note:  This event is being hoisted by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions regarding this event, please contact Dave directly at [masked].

The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

Why does the event organizer have +40 for his RSVP's? That is because there are 8 Meetup.com groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com promoting this event.  There will be many more people than what you see below attending.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go? We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.

General Admission is $5.00.  Please bring exact change to the door.

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (www.newyorksocialnetwork.com).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].
results.name: New and Existing Members Welcome Party

results.description:
We have had some local players tell us the field is usually empty these nights. The parks dept refuses to give us a permit for the time. I am willing to try and see if we can get the games in on the off weeks until the Winter Season starts on 12/5, when we have the permit for every Saturday again.

Please remember we have no permit. I will hold the game and hope for the best. Their will be no payment for this game.

Same Rules Apply

Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) Keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot. No-Shows will be banned from the group.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - No Permit - But Empty Field

results.description:
We may still be lamenting the loss of summer, and warmer temperatures. But it also means the return of some of fun winter activities, especially our fun game nights. So come, have a drink, meet good people and play some great games.

The list of games I will bring is down below. I tried to include a little bit of everything. But if you have a favorite game, please feel free to bring it.

We should be easy to find in the bar. But just in case you can reach me on my cell[masked] 2767.

The List of Games:

Bananagrams - The anagram game that will drive you BANANAS! Race to build your own crossword grid!

Forbidden Island - Join a team of fearless adventurers on a do-or-die mission to capture four sacred treasures from the ruins of this perilous paradise

Loot - Yo-Ho-Ho and a Barrel of Fun! Set sail for an exciting adventure of strategy and skullduggery in this captivating card game. Storm your opponents' merchant ships and seize valuable treasure. Trivia Pursuit - Bet You know it - When you play it, you don't have to know all the answers to win - it's what you think your friends know that really counts. Bet they'll know it or bet they won't, either way a smart bet can turn your winnings into wedges

Balderdash - the outrageous bluffing game

Pass the Pop Corn - Movie trivia

Scrabble Slam - a high-speed four letter word game, race to change the existing word and get rid of your cards

I will also bring cards, uno, cards game versions of scattergories, battleship, monopoly, and clue for those of us who prefer more traditional, party games
results.name: Card + Board Game Night @ Cherry Tree

results.description:
Just found out that the brooklyn museum is free today from 5 pm - 11 pm! I would love to go check it out late tonight and hope someone else is interested - otherwise will schedule the same meetup for next month when they do the event in December. 

https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/visit/hours_admission/dining/

*********************

Join us for Target First Saturdays and enjoy engaging and eclectic free art and entertainment programs every month (except September), from 5 to 11 p.m. Our new B Café offers artist-created sandwiches, as well as salads, sweets, and a variety of beverages. Parking is a flat rate of $6 starting at 5 p.m. (All other Saturdays, we close at 6 p.m.)

Some Target First Saturday activities take place in smaller and more intimate locations in the Museum, so you’ll need a ticket for those programs. Ticket lines often form 30 minutes before tickets are distributed at the Admissions Desk. If you’re a Member, pick up tickets from the Membership Desk while supplies last. While we do our best to keep our listings as up-to-date as possible, sometimes last-minute program changes are unavoidable.
results.name: Broolyn Museum - Free target Saturday

group.name: Idealistic cynics forming a montage-worthy group of friends

results.description:
Come out for some Karaoke fun this Saturday at Mickey's Bar & Grill in Lyndhurst, NJ.


Mickey's is your hot spot for Karaoke fun and all the NFL games with great food and awesome wings!

Always free, never a cove charge!

Phone[masked]
results.name: Free Karaoke Party Saturday @ Mickey's in Lyndhurst

results.description:
The Art of Sharing Your Voice:

        A Night of Music, Poetry, Comedy, & Conversation

Join Amy Leo and Friends for another night of musical shenanigans. Amy will start by sharing what she is learning in the field of mental health education and how it can translate to greater freedom for all of us in sharing our art, voices, and message.


We will briefly explore how to increase our impact as performers or advocates while experiencing greater clarity, ease, and simplicity.

After that, the open mic will start up! All artists are welcome: singers, songwriters, musicians, poets, comedians, actors, and other performers.

Notes:
This is a very laid-back and quaint venue to which we have had great fun and great vibes at in the past. This venue is a private, white house with a windowed front, that has been hosting events for the past 20 years. 

Also, perfection is not required, just an open-mind and big-heart that wants to rock! Let's make music and performing fun again.

results.description:
'Tis the season for ghost stories and an old town like New York is full of haunted places. Some of those haunted places just happen to be some of the oldest bars in the city. The Landmark Tavern, a Hell's Kitchen fixture since at least 1866, is one of those places.

The upscale Irish pub, once the haunt of longshoremen and the Westies Irish-American street gang, has seen its share of shady characters over the years. And some of them have stuck around. The pub is said to be haunted by the ghost of a former Confederate soldier who died there after being stabbed to death in a fight shortly after the Civil War. He frequently removes books from the bookshelf of the second floor party room and the bathtub he was said to have died in remains.

Another frequent ghost siting is that of a 19th century Irish girl who died of cholera or typhoid fever. But her spirit continues to wander around the building's third floor.

Even the ghost of Hollywood actor George Raft, who played the heavy in a number of 1930s gangster movies, is said to make an occasional appearance. Raft grew up in Hell's Kitchen in the early 20th century and was a frequent patron of the Landmark throughout his adult life. 

This meetup is definitely not for the faint of heart. ;-) But if you can stand a good scare, please join us for a fun-filled night. Even if no ghosts make an appearance, we'll be able to enjoy an evening in one of New York's oldest Irish pubs, meticulously restored to its Victorian era charm with original mahogany bar, tile floors and stamped tin ceiling.

Meet at the bar for drinks and food around 8:30.  We'll get a guided tour from one of the bar's owners and get to hear from the staff of their first-hand encounters with the resident ghosts and specters.

It should be a fun night, see you there.
results.name: Haunted Old New York Bars: The Landmark Tavern

Join Us For The Tough Mudder NJ Challenge, There is no way you're escaping getting dirty on this one.


Tough Mudder is a team-oriented 10-12 mile (18-20 km) obstacle course designed to test physical strength and mental grit. Tough Mudder puts camaraderie over finisher rankings and is not a timed race but a team challenge that allows participants to experience exhilarating, yet safe, world-class obstacles they won't find anywhere else.

Are you ready to unleash the Zerker in you by pushing your mental and physical limits at Tough Mudder NJ? Join our team and run with like-minded adventure seeking individuals like you.

This event will truly challenge you to new levels.

results.description:
GROW is a one-day symposium geared toward emerging leaders and mid-career architects seeking inspiration and knowledge. Whether you are moving up in your current firm or thinking about starting a new one, learn critical skills and new ways to think about practice from leaders who are reshaping the business of architecture.

Program:
REGISTRATION/BREAKFAST 8:00 - 8:30AM
Opportunity for networking with peers

MORNING SESSIONS:
8:30 AM - 9:30 AM Opening Plenary
Introduction: Carol Loewenson, FAIA, 2015 AIANY Vice-President
Keynote Speaker: Paola Moya, Assoc. AIA, NOMA, Principal, Marshall Moya Design

9:40 AM - 10:40 AM Business Development
Speakers:
Arielle Assouline-Lichten, Principal and Founding Partner, Slash Projects
Pablo Castro, AIA, Founding Principal, Obra Architects
Keith Kennedy, Director of Marketing, STUDIOS Architecture

10:50 AM -11:50 AM Business Structure and Operations
Speakers:
Thomas Gluck, Principal, GLUCK+
Scott Francisco, Director, Pilot Projects

11:50 AM - 1:00 PM: LUNCH

AFTERNOON SESSIONS: 1:00 PM – 5:00 PM
1:00 PM - 2:00 PM Financial Management
Speaker: Rena M. Klein, FAIA, Principal, RM Klein Consulting

2:10 PM - 3:00 PM Talent Management
Speakers:
Andrea Lamberti, AIA, Partner, Rafael Viñoly Architects
Joel Peterson, Director of Human Resources, Goshow Architects

3:00 PM - 4:15 PM Presentation Skills
Speaker: Susan Murphy, Principal, Murphy Motivation and Training

4:20 PM - 5:00 PM Closing Plenary
Panel of the day's speakers with an interactive dialogue on key learning gathered during the day

Organized by: AIANY Professional Practice Committee and AIA National Practice Management Knowledge Community (PMKC)

Price:
Registration by October 25: $50 for AIA members; $75 for non-members
Registration after October 25: $75 for AIA members, $100 for non-members
results.name: GROW Practice, Profession & Career: Cultivating the Next Generation of Leaders

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.description:
Hi ladies, 

The Church of St Francis Xavier does weekly soup kitchen and clothing drives. Let's support their efforts by spending a few hours on Sun Aug 16th feeding the hungry!

Food will need to be served to patrons and the kitchen cleared post service. In the past over 1,000 meals have been served to the poor.

Please RSVP as soon as possible and if you would like to attend but can't stay the whole 4hrs contact me prior to entering your RSVP.

This community outreach is dependent on us volunteers so your commitment to spending your time is generous and appreciated! Can't wait to see you all there!

Contact me with any questions. 

Note: a wait list has been activated as the number of volteers is limited; wear comfortable clothes and shoes

http://stfrancispantries.org/community-programs/sunday-meals-at-st-francis-xavier-soup-kitchen.html

Regards,

Janell

results.description:
Let's head out for a MidPackers Long, Slow Distance (MPLSD) Run. We will start and finish at the Starbucks on Queens Blvd and 46th Street.


Details: 
8:30am, Starbucks in Sunnyside; 10:00–11:00 minute pace.

Watch the comments section for details about this week's MPLSD, including route, total distance and any other specifics that you'll need to know. Please make sure you are able to run the posted distance. This is for your safety and to help keep the group moving at a consistent pace. It's a good idea to bring your Metrocard and some cash in case you need to cut the run short. If you're a faster runner, please study the route in case you wish to run ahead.  

Be sure to bring along any fluids and/or nutrition you may need to successfully complete this distance. This is for your health, safety, and comfort.

Questions or problems then give me a call at[masked] but I usually won't be answering as I'll be setting up the field or playing...

Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned, permanently! results.description:
Come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.


Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the meetup.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
New Date: 11/8 Sunday

Horseback Trail Riding

Bronx Equestrian Center is a full service equestrian facility located in Pelham Bay Park. Western and English styles of riding are available for all levels of experience and interest. From pony rides and trail rides to haywagon rides and weddings... we have something for everyone. Come and say hello and meet our friendly horses and staff.

Enjoy a relaxing ride thru the beautiful woods of Pelham Bay Park. We have horses for people of all riding abilities – from beginer to advanced. 

After the riding, we can have lunch at nearby picturesque City Island.

Kazimiroff Nature Trail - Pelham Bay Park

After lunch, we can have a fall foliage walk in Kazimiroff Nature Trail - Best Walk New York 2012 according to the Village Voice, and Orchard Beach. An easy walk of about 2 miles long.

Depart Date: November 8th Sunday; arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 8:45 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 9:30 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Expect to be back in NYC at 5:00 PM and Flushing at 5:30 PM

Cost: Early birds $59 for first 8 spots or 10 days in advance; Regular $69 afterward. Please only RSVP here after you have purchased the ticket.

Trip includes: Round trip transportation from NYC, 1 hour of horseback riding & fall foliage walk in Kazimiroff Nature Trail.

Buy Ticket Here: http://oct2015horsebackriding.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) If Quickpaying, please indicate your boarding location. Your spot is not confirmed until your payment is received.

Refund Policy:
* Full refund minus $10 processing fee if cancelled 2 weeks in advance;
* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show; however, you can transfer your spot to other with $10 transfer fee.

Official Site: http://www.bronxequestriancenter.com/

Pictures from the Previous Trips:
http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/24484822/
http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/25708012/

results.description: This Sunday, lets meet 9am at the Claypit Creek parking area located at Hartshorne Woods.  On Locust Ave, you will see a Hartshorne Woods - Claypit Creek sign to the parking area.  Use 259 Locust Ave, Rumson, NJ for your GPS.  You can get detailed driving directions to the Claypit Creek parking area off of the Monmouth County Park System website - specific to the Hartshorne Woods park.  The park system rates this as an easy to moderate walk of approximately 4 miles.  If you've done our Cheesequake Park walk, this one is similar in length and terrain. The county created a new trail recently that links the Claypit Creek area with the existing Laurel Ridge trail in Hartshorne Woods. There are some uneven / hilly sections of trail and more than a few tree roots and rocks, so hiking boots/shoes are suggested.  Though this walk is mostly shady, a bottle of water is good to bring along.  We will plan to eat at Sissy's on the Water after the walk. There is a porto adjacent to the Claypit Creek parking area and another along the walk.  Thanks for coming 10 minutes early - and please no furry, four-legged friends.

results.description:
TEAM WALNUT - American Brain Tumor Association walk or run NYC

there is a $35.00 fee for this event


TEAM WALNUT will be participating in the BT5K New York Breakthrough for Brain Tumors Run & Walk, (as walkers!!!!) an inspiring and fun event benefitting the American Brain Tumor Association.

In May of 2014 I had brain surgery(Lisa Cohen ) , I've lived in inpatient rehabilitation, struggled through out patient and I'm finally back in graduate school. Please consider joining me in support.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QOPiZYNEe8A

JOIN THE TEAM!

The more the merrier! I’m inviting all my friends to join my team in support of the nearly 700,000 people currently living with a brain tumor. You can join my team by clicking the join button on the right.

DONATE!
If you can’t make it to the BT5K New York on November 8, 2015, please consider making a donation to the American Brain Tumor Association in support of the team’s efforts. Click the donate button on the right.

Thank you in advance for your support of our efforts on behalf of brain tumor patients, their families, and the researchers pursuing the breakthroughs.


http://hope.abta.org/site/TR/BT5K/BT5K-2015?pg=team&fr_id=3361&team_id=35539#.Vj0orCtUWD_
