results.description:
Prepay requiredhttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5916 

Sunday, November 8th- 1:30 PM 

ENDANGERED SPECIES TOUR 

Notes: 
*The event is rain or shine. If it too cold or rains, we will substitute the Jungle World Tour which is indoors. 
*This event is open to all and is not meant to be age specific or gender balanced. 

=================================== 

Bronx Zoo Tour for Singles 
With our own Private Tour Guide

This is a great event where you can experience some of the Endangered Wildlife that calls the Bronx Zoo home.  At the same time, meet some fun singles, make some new friends and maybe more at this great informal event.

How it works/ Itinerary 

The tour starts at 1:30 PM SHARP (arrive by 1:00 PM), (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the Zoo.

We will be doing the Endangered Wildlife tour which will explore the causes as to why wildlife is disappearing learning what conservation actions people can take to prevent it.  Animals we will visit may include but are not limited to:

Western Lowland Gorillas

Snow Leopards

Polar Bears

White Rhino

Malayan Tapir

Black Leopard

Amur Tiger

 Note: This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific.  Please attend if you have an interest in the museum and are looking to meet other fun singles.


Meeting Locations 

Option 1) We will meet at Penn Station and take the train together (11:30 am).  It lets us off just a few blocks from the Zoo

Option 2) Meet at the Zoo

NOTE:  You must arrive by 1 PM.. Tour starts at 1:30. If you arrive after we leave you will have no way to find the group. 

The Tour goes for two hours and is rain or shine.  They have indoor exhibits if it rains.. 

$39.75-$49.75 depending on how early you register.


Prepay requiredhttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5916
results.name: Singles Bronx Zoo Tour (Prepay Only)

results.description:
November 8, 2015

Psychic Self-Defense

Psychic Self-Defense v. Negative Magick Proteting yourself Working Safely Psychic Development


$25 in person/$27 via paypal - PLEASE bring your receipt to class.

WFT Academy of Pagan Studies (WFTAPS) offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Making A BOS, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more.

What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.

Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now NEW! launching in 2013 online classes which will have our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment.  Students can join this blog as long as they have registered at WFTAPS for classes

The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!

We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.

We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished thus far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Academy and do hope that after reading this, you will decide to join us as at the Academy as a Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.

We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com
www.romanctichandfastings.webs.com
www.charmedbystarr.com for all your ritual and pagan items.

results.description:
JOIN US AS CAAF'S GOES AFTER THE MOST DESPICABLE FUR PEDDLERS IN NYC!

These are the animal abusers who thought they were under the radar, renting out locales throughout the city and brazenly promoting their animal carcasses by handing out postcards on street corners.

These animal abusers first met CAAF at the end of the 2011 Bergdorf march against fur/demo, when a small contingent of activists held an impromptu demo at their store. These cowards overreacted and locked the door. Unfortunately the millions of frightened injured trapped animals whose death they're responsible for, had no such barricade to save their lives.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WHAT: ** CAAF "No More Fur" demo @ The Fur Source of NY **

WHERE: The Fur Source of NY, 3 West 57th St. (between 5th & 6th Aves.), NYC

WHEN: Sunday, November 8th, 2015

TIME: 1:00pm ~ 3:00pm

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLEASE COME OUT FOR THIS DEMO! There is no ethical defense for what these people do. This store does not sell appliances, toys or some cruelty free clothing like our other targets. This is a furrier. They only sell fur. THIS IS PURE EVIL and they've been getting away with this UNCHALLENGED FOR FAR TOO LONG.

We need you to come to this demo.

It's time to send a message. FUR IS MURDER!
results.name: CAAF "No More Fur" Demo @ The Fur Source 3 West 57th St. NYC

results.description:
This is a great informal event where you can experience the Bronx Zoo and at the same time, meet some fun singles and make some new friends! This will be our final tour of the year! 

Depending upon the weather, we will either do the Endangered Species Tour or the Jungle World Tour, which is indoors. 

Our last tour sold out quickly and this will be our last one of the year so get your tix ASAP - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bronxzoo/dates/Nov-08-2015_at_0100PM

How it works/Itinerary: 

Arrive by 1pm (specific location will be emailed to you once you purchase ticket, closer to event). 

You will be introduced to the other attendees and receive your admission tickets to the Zoo. The tour starts at 1:30pm SHARP with our private tour guide.

Tickets are $39.75 - $49.75 depending on when you register for tickets. 

PREPAY ONLY (No Tix Sold At Door). BUY TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bronxzoo/dates/Nov-08-2015_at_0100PM

*Meeting Locations:

Option 1) We will meet at Penn Station and take the train together. It lets us off just a few blocks from the Zoo

Option 2) Meet at the Zoo

*NOTE: You must arrive by 1 PM. Tour starts at 1:30. If you arrive after we leave you will have no way to find the group.

The Tour goes for two hours and is rain or shine. We will tour the indoor exhibits if it rains or is too cold. This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age/ethnic specific. 

Multiple Meetup groups are co-organizing so don't just go by the RSVPs you see here. We'll have up to 40 members attending.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bronxzoo/dates/Nov-08-2015_at_0100PM

venue.address_1: Tillary St and Cadman Plaza W
venue.name: Cadman Plaza (Turf Fields)

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game for all levels. 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash to the game. 

RSVP closes at 11:15AM (2 hours before the game)

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.
results.name: PICK UP GAME SUN 1:15 PM Cadman Plaza

group.name: Brooklyn Soccer Club - Adult Soccer lessons and pickup games

results.description:
Who's ready to do something fun & different? A Pub Crawl for Juice...experience a hangover that leaves you feeling healthy & energized! 

What is a Juice Crawl? 

It's a fun, social and healthy living event similar to a traditional pub crawl except we workout and travel to juice bars. Hang with fellow juice lovers, yogis, runners, health conscious individuals etc... Anyone is welcome! 

1 TICKET COVERS IT ALL: 
Sample 20 + different types of juices. 
Free Yoga Class. 
Total value = over $100

*Tickets for our group are just $40 until Oct 18th. $57 after or save 10% when you bring a friend w/ discount code "10" (discount only good at $57 price level w/ friend).

*Must purchase ticket in advance at this link to attend - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/juice-crawl/

*Approximate Timeline (may vary):

The tour starts at 1:30 PM SHARP (arrive by 1:00 PM), (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the Zoo.

results.description:
Come experience the Healing Power of Sound & Vibration from a range of wonderful instruments in a circle designed to open our hearts, relax our minds, and inspire our spirits. Utilizing Native American Flute, Celtic Harp, Singing Bowls, Didgeridoo and Shaman Drums & more! 

Sound Healing helps to:

• Relieve Stress 

• Calm Emotions

• Clear Your Thoughts

• Deepen Self Awareness

• Enhance Well Being

• Strengthen The Immune System 

• Enhance Your Connection To Your Purpose

Sage Logan: is a trained Musician and Composer. He was raised with family practices of African American folk magic known as Rootwork. He is also a Shamanic Practitioner, and has learned sacred ceremonies, and healing techniques first hand from indigenous healers, from the Lakota & Cherokee traditions, healers from Peru & Ecuador, the Maori of New Zealand, South African Sangoma’s & many more. Sage is an organizer, of the NY Shamanic Circle, NYC’s eldest Shamanic non-profit organization.

For Question Please Email [masked]

Dress comfortably for meditation, movement and relaxation. Please bring a notebook & pen, bandanna & water to drink. Musicians please feel free to bring and instrument with you to join in, meditative Instruments are especially welcome!
results.how_to_find_us: At Union Square on 17th Street, Building Next to the Restaurant PotBelly
results.name: NYSC Sound Circle Led by Sage Logan

results.description:
We'll meet at Dyckman St & Payson Ave at 1:30pm, 2 blocks west of the Dyckman (= 200th) St stop on the A train, about 40 minutes north of Times Square. We'll probably be reaching the restaurant at the end at about 4:25pm, with the sun setting at 4:45pm.  After dinner at the end of the hike, you can walk a few blocks south to the 181st St stop on the A train to go home.

Heavy rain cancels.

Walkers should realize that if I (the leader) am interested in getting to know you, I am helpless to do so unless you'll walk at the front and talk with me, since I'm stuck at the front of the pack.  So by all means, walk up front and join in the conversation.

This walk involves a couple of less well-known parks at the very northernmost tip of Manhattan, but both of these parks are a delight, with spectacular views through the trees over the Hudson. We'll start with 3 miles through Inwood Hill Park, which has a real wilderness feel to it, you just can't believe you're in Manhattan when you're here, it feels like you're 100 miles from the nearest city. We'll visit Shorakkopoch, the site where the Dutch bought Manhattan from the Native Americans for the equivalent of $41 in 1626.

After that we'll go through Fort Tryon park, also scenic, and down into Washington Heights where we'll dine at an Indian restaurant to be disclosed on the walk.  We really don't want people skipping the walk and just joining the group for dinner -- this is a hiking meetup, not a dining one.

You can read about Inwood Hill Park at http://forgotten-ny.com/2000/04/inwood-hill-park/

Though this walk is only 4.5 miles, it is quite strenuous because the terrain in Washington Heights tends to be very steep. Most but not all of the path is paved.

Attendance at this event is free, and by attending, you agree that you and any guests participate at your own risk, and that you will not take any legal action against the organizers of this group for anything unfortunate that may happen during this outing. There is especially a risk that you will get separated from the group and lost, and if that happens the responsibility will be yours. Every participant will be required to sign a liability waiver, the current draft of which you can read online here: http://www.bluejacket7.com/legal/WalkingWaiver.doc
results.how_to_find_us: We will probably be the only group there, and I look like my picture.
results.name: 4.5 Mile Fall Colors Washington Heights Hike

results.description:
Greetings!  As we’ve done for awhile, we’re ready to read the #2 choice in our recent poll--Inferno by Larry Niven & Jerry Pournelle:

Inferno is based upon the hell described in Dante's Inferno. However, it adds a modern twist to the story. The story is told in the first person by Allen Carpentier (né Carpenter), an agnostic science fiction writer who died in a failed attempt to entertain his fans at a Science fiction convention party. He is only released, after many decades, from a Djinn-bottle in the Vestibule on the outer edge to Hell when he finally calls upon God for mercy. Upon release he is met by Benito, or Benny, a Virgil-like figure whose full identity is not immediately apparent. Benito offers to take him out of Hell by bringing him to the center.

At first, as Allen and Benito travel through Hell, Allen tries to scientifically rationalize everything he sees, renaming his surroundings as 'Infernoland', a high-tech amusement park some thousand years in the future. It isn't until he sees a man recover from incineration and his own leg heal from a compound fracture that he starts to actually believe that he is in Hell. From this point on, as Allen travels through the inner circles of Hell, he sees how he is guilty of each of the sins in some fashion, commenting to himself that he is in no danger from ditch 3 of circle 8 (simony) only because he has never had any holy offices to sell. At first Allen views the punishments for these sins as far surpassing the crime, repeatedly thinking, "We're in the hands of infinite power and infinite sadism", although he comes to more and more to accept the justice of the situation as he realizes that it is their continuing denial of their sins that keeps many of the condemned in hell. Eventually Allen takes over Benito's role in helping reformed souls proceed onto Paradise via Purgatory, allowing Benito to move on towards Purgatory himself. It is revealed that Benito is actually Benito Mussolini, the former dictator of Italy.

Along the way Allen meets a number of his Californian acquaintances and notable people from history (e.g. Epictetus, Billy the Kid, Jesse James, Bob Ford, L Ron Hubbard, Henry VIII of England, Vlad Tepes, Aimee Semple McPherson, William M. Tweed, Al Capone) and from classical mythology (e.g. Hector, Aeneas, Charon, Minos, Phlegyas, Geryon). Due to the long time he spent bottled up in the outer vestibule he also meets some people from the future of 1976, such as a space shuttle pilot.


LOCATION
We will be meeting at the Citigroup Atrium.

There is an entrance at 53rd and Lexington Avenue off of the 53rd and Lex subway stop. You have to go down the steps; the subway station will be on your right and the Atrium will be straight in front of you. The doors are labelled.   

There is a Barnes and Noble (with a Starbucks inside) located on the next level up at 54th and 3rd. If you enter through the B&N, you will need to go through B&N (up a few steps from the entrance), past the NOOK display to the glass doors and down the escalator to the Atrium.

There is free wi-fi in the Citigroup Atrium. There are also free public restrooms. Please let me know if you have any questions about the location.

It's probably more fun if you read/finish the book.  But if you don’t, you are still welcome to come. But there will be spoilers!

WHERE TO BUY
The book is available in many formats, including Kindle (for only $1.99!) and paperback at Amazon</a> and a Nook and paperback at <a href="http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/inferno-larry-niven/1100358339">Barnes & Noble.


IMPORTANT RSVP POLICY
If you RSVP and find you cannot make it, please change your RSVP so that we are not waiting for you. Please change it no less than two hours before the scheduled meeting time. If you RSVP and do not show, you will have to pay $10 when you attend your next event. This is to prevent those on the waiting list from missing out on an event.   

The RSVP policy is the same as for the general meetup. Please see the entire policy here:  http://www.meetup.com/NYSciFi-Fantasy/pages/Membership_Policy/

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 2pm-4:30pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Join us for a Cuddle Party - an experiential workshop and social event.  Where else can you attend a workshop in your pajamas, or yoga clothes.

To attend you must purchase a ticket in advance. See details below.


Cuddle Party is … a workshop!

Though touch is natural, the skills that make it welcome and enjoyable have to be learned. Skills of communication, boundaries, asking for what you want, and saying ‘Yes’ or ‘No’ with clarity and kindness.

Cuddle Party is led by trained and certified Cuddle Party Facilitators. The Facilitator’s job is to guide you into those skills gently and easily, in a fun, safe and light hearted way. We welcome you and create an atmosphere of respect, and remain available for questions and support.

At a Cuddle Party you gain:
* Clarity and confidence
* Boundary and communication skills
* Comfort, support and encouragement
* The secrets to welcome, relaxed, non-sexual touch

The skills you learn at Cuddle Party translate into every day life, right from the start. When boundaries and consent are clear, every relationship is easier.

Where else can you attend a workshop in your pajamas?

Cuddle Party is … a social event!


We open with a Welcome Circle - about 45 minutes of introductions, rules and a few games to help everyone get comfortable. We teach communication and boundary skills in ways that are lighthearted and fun.

Then we open up for ‘free-style’ cuddling. You have plenty of time to relax, chat, share a back rub or other welcome touch, cuddle, have a snack or just hang out.

You can come to a Cuddle Party to meet new people, to enjoy amazing conversations, to touch, to be touched, to have fun, to practice asking for what you want, to practice saying “no” to what you don’t want — all in a setting structured to be a safe place for exploration and enjoyment. Shucks, you can even come to a Cuddle Party just to cuddle!

These are the Cuddle Party rules.

1) Pajamas (or cuddle-clothes) stay on the whole time.

2) You don't have to cuddle anyone at a Cuddle Party, ever.

3) You must ask permission and receive a verbal YES before you touch anyone. (Be as specific in your request as you can.)

4) If you're a yes, say YES. If you're a no, say NO.

5) If you're a maybe, say NO.

6) You are encouraged to change your mind anytime you want.

7) Respect your relationship agreements and communicate with your partner.

8) Get me of my assistant if you have a questions or concern or need assistance with anything during the Cuddle Party.

9) Tears and laughter are both welcome.

10) Respect people's privacy when sharing about Cuddle Parties and do not gossip.

11) Arrive on time.

12) Be hygienically savvy.

Want to know more about Cuddle Party?

Cuddle Party has been around since February 2004.


There is lots of information about Cuddle Parties on the official Cuddle Party website www.cuddleparty.com so if you are curious, be sure to check out the FAQ section and some of the articles too

Be On Time: PLEASE arrive on time at 2:00 PM to check-in and change into your Cuddle Clothes so we can start the Welcome Circle by 2:30 PM.

No Late Arrivals: Sorry - but after the Welcome Circle begins, no late arrivals can enter

What To Wear: Pajamas/Athletic Wear.  Think more comfy than sexy. 

What To Bring: A pillow or stuffed animal if you like. Otherwise, just bring your smiling self.

Your Cuddle Host will provide light snacks and beverages.

Looking forward to Cuddling with you soon,

Registration Details


Cost: $25

Purchase Tickets Here


When you register or attend please make a point to mention to us you found this event through NYC Pleasure without Borders MeetUp.

You must get a ticket in advance. This is the only way to ensure space will be reserved for you. Tickets must be purchased in advance - they will not be sold at the door Cost: Men $25 in advance; Women $25 in advance.

Eventbrite requires credit card payments. Sorry no exceptions or walk-ins.

Got Questions? You can post them below.
results.name: Cuddle Party™ For All Genders - Experiential Intimacy Workshop & Social Event

results.description:
This group is dedicated exclusively to novels. Please read the Novel Group Intro and FAQ before attending.  Be prepared to read back through previous chapters of a novel-in-progress before committing to this group.

HOW MEMBERS SUBMIT NOVEL SECTIONS:



Email your submission to [masked] 

SUBJECT: The Title of the group you're submitting to and your name. EXAMPLE: Cam's Novel Group December 8th, Spidercam
MESSAGE: Name, Title, Word Count, any additional info. EXAMPLE: Spidercam, Glory Chapter 2, 7,000 words. This is a rewrite.
Send to [masked]

Attach your document. RTF and DOC are preferred. Please, NO PDF's or DOCx. 


What to Expect: Nine days before the meeting you will receive an email from Meetup with links to download each story for critique from our Dropbox account. Click on the link and download the stories.

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. See our Procedures, located under the Pages tab, for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.


Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure in place to make sure the critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, and that the writers leave with a clear idea of what to do with their stories next. You can find advice about how to give a critique here.

We'll also spend some time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know, so the social element of the group is as important as the work itself!
results.name: Cam's Novel Group

results.description:
Film Screening of "The Gig"  at The Jewish Museum NJ.  

This feature film tells the story of a group of Amatuer Jewish jazz players who recruit an African-American professional bass player to help them with their big two week gig at a Catskills resort.

2 p.m. screening of the film 

A new exhibit at The Jewish Museum NJ explores the relationships among Jews and African Americans in the shaping of an innately American art. http://www.jewishmuseum.org

October 15 through December 13. Sundays, noon-5pm, Tuesdays, 2-4pm, Thursdays, 6-8pm and by appointment at 

<a>(973)[masked]</a>

Jewish Museum of New Jersey at Congregation Ahavas Sholom, 145 Broadway, Newark

Jazz, Jews, and African Americans: Cultural Intersections in Newark and Beyond is an exhibit that explores the relationships among Jews and African-Americans in the performance, production and promotion of jazz. Utilizing photos, documents and text, it tells the story of the interactions and influences between Jews and African Americans in creating a new kind of music, which originated on the margins of society and grew to prominence on the American cultural landscape. With an emphasis on Newark’s jazz history, the exhibit examines the cooperative and sometimes contentious relationships of Jews and African Americans in the jazz community and addresses the interplay of racial/ethnic and spiritual identities that informed this innately American art.

This exhibit is co-produced by NJPAC, the Institute of Jazz Studies at Rutgers-Newark, the Jewish Museum of New Jersey at Congregation Ahavas Sholom, and WBGO Jazz 88.3FM, and presented in partnership with seven religious, educational and cultural institutions.
results.name: Film Screening of "The Gig"  at The Jewish Museum NJ

results.description:
We are thrilled to welcome philosophy PhD candidate Matt Moss, who will present on Descartes' cogito argument.  The two readings can be found, as always, under More -> Files.

From Matt:

The cogito argument — “I think, therefore I am” (Je pense, donc je suis) — is one of the most famous in all of Western philosophy. It is also one of the most misunderstood. It is controversial whether the argument works, and how it is supposed to work.  Some have maintained that it’s simply invalid, or just unpacks a triviality; others that it is valid and generates knowledge, defeating the specific form of skepticism Descartes intended it to. For this meetup, we will discuss the meaning and force of the cogito argument. 

The main reading is Part Four of Descartes’ Discourse on Method, the most prominent place where the argument appears. I have attached a .pdf of the whole of the Discourse in an English translation, so that anyone who wants to read a bit more of the Discourse can do so (it is not very long, totaling 44 pages). Part Four is pages 18-22. I am also including, for comparison, a .pdf where I have excerpted the two other appearances the cogito argument makes in Descartes’ writings, in the Meditations (ego sum, ego existo, “I think, I exist”) and in the Principles of Philosophy (ego cogito, ergo sum, “I think, therefore I am”).
results.name: Meeting 32: Descartes - I think, therefore I am

Join New York Adventure Club on Sunday, November 8th, for a private tour of the perfectly preserved Louis Armstrong House Museum in Corona, Queens.

results.description:
Are You A Highly Sensitive Person or Empath?

An individual who is known to feel other people’s energy and emotions is known to be an empath. A highly sensitive individual has spiritual, emotional and energetic perceptions. This physical and emotional trait is inherited. One out of five Americans has the trait of sensitivity. All sensitives aren't empaths but all empaths are sensitive. In this workshop we will learn the differences between sensitivity and empathy. We will also explore some of the physical, emotional, spiritual and mental manifestations which come from being born sensitive.

Can you identify with the following?


Being labeled as too emotional or sensitive?
Are your feelings hurt easily?
Do you get overstimulated when under pressure?
Do you feel nervous or anxious around loud noises, weird smells or textures, and bright lights?
Do you find that you eat, drink, smoke or use recreational drugs to turn yourself off, emotionally and mentally?

In this workshop we will learn how to manage our sensitivity through learning about the spiritual gift of sensitivity and empathy. We will also learn about highly sensitive people and empaths through my personal teachings and the teachings of Dr Elaine Aran, the author of the Highly Sensitive Person and Dr. Michael R. Smith the author of the Empath Connection.

This workshop is being held at Aum Shanti formally known as Aum Namaste at 226 East 14 St. N.Y. N.Y. 10003. The cost is $25.00 and Payment can be paid through this website or at the door.

I look forward to seeing you all November 8, 2015 

Love and light,

Laura Schwalm-Anthony
results.name: Empath and Sensitive Workshop

You will find famous places where celebrities of 20th century liked to come for a cup of coffee and chat with friends and acquaintances. Woody Allen, Andy Warhol, Valery Solanas, John Tyler, Jackson Pollock, Eugene O`Neill, Charlie Chaplin, Gregory Corso, Bob Dylan, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Allen Ginsberg, LeRoi Jones, Jack Kerouac,Ray Bremser, Jimi Hendrix, Bruce Springsteen, The Velvet Underground, Cat Mother & the All Night Newsboys, Kool and the Gang, Peter, Paul & Mary,  Lenny Bruce, Joan Rivers and many more- feel like a part of New York Bohemia. There is no other place like New York. This tour will include the sample of authentic New York style food such as pizza, falafel, riceballs and more.

Washington Square

New York University

New York Authentic Food

Musicians memorable places

"Stonewall Inn" Riot and more

The Fearless Living Book group is a 4 week book group. The work is based on Rhonda Britten's Fearless Living book. Sunday, November 8, at 3pm we will discuss the Expectations chapter. We will discuss how having Expectations are based on fear. We will go deeper into what fear truly is. The book group will meet on a conference call line for 1 hour a week every Sunday at 3 p.m. I am also offering 2 free 1 on 1 coaching sessions those who join the book group. I posted a picture of the Fearless Living book by Rhonda Britten in a photo album on the meetup. Thank you for signing up! If you need any other information, please let me know.

As soon as we see how many members want to attend, I will book the space at a rehearsal hall probably at 36th Street and 8th Avenue where they charge per hour. The price will probably average out to about $10 or less per person to be paid at the time.

Look forward to meeting you and singing with you!

results.description:
On this final day of Stoic Week 2015, we'll share our experiences and have an open discussion and Q&A on how Stoic Week 2015 went for those of us who participated.

Here's an outline of what we'll be doing at next meetup:

• First, we'll read and discuss the quotes for each day and then share and compare our results from each day's main exercise


• Then, we'll discuss our overall experiences with Stoic Week 2015 as well as Stoic practice in general


• Finally, we'll have an open Q&A on any and all aspects of Stoicism as a whole

I'll also try to bring a computer if people need help filling out their psychometric forms if needed.

To prepare, think of a few questions you have or experiences you'd like to share. What was your favorite exercise or topic during Stoic Week 2015? What didn't work so well for you?

While the bulk of this meetup will be focused on Stoic Week 2015, people who did not participate are welcome to attend, since you may still get something out of our review of the Stoic Week material and there will be time at the end to discuss Stoicism in general.
results.name: Stoic Week 2015 Debriefing

Join us in welcoming the highly acclaimed trio, 8 Strings & a Whistle, to Art on the Corner's Concert Series! 8 Strings & a Whistle has been captivating audiences throughout the United States since 1998. A cutting edge presence, 8 Strings & a Whistle is committed to presenting works and expanding the repertoire for the unique combination of flute, viola and cello. The trio has championed Baroque, Classical and Romantic repertoire and collaborates regularly with living composers, premiering and workshopping their pieces throughout the concert season. The program includes Trio for flute, viola and cello, OP.1 by Joseph Mysliwecek [masked]); Trio by Octavio Vazquez (Spanish/ American composer; written in 2001); Bad Robots by Edmund Cionek (American and NY based composer; written for 8S&W in 2010 and appearing on our upcoming CD); Romanian Folk Dances by Bela Bartok (arrangement by 8S&W); and the premiere of Trio for 8 Strings & a Whistle by Frank E. Warren (American composer; written for 8S&W).

• LADIES ONLY!


• This game supports the SoccerWithoutBorders Program for Girls in Granada, Nicaragua

• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED per park rules (turf shoes are okay)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: We have a permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

The game is open to 24 player - 11v11 w/ 1 sub each team. 

(Leader- Silvia Echeverria­)


(Co-Leader- TBD, please contact us if you interested in helping )

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for any game. Games may be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

If you are looking to introduce meditation in your life or meditate with a group, join us for this free one hour session. 

You will get to learn about our mind, and how we can achieve a happy and peaceful state of mind through breath & meditation. 

You will get a taste of the peace and clarity one can achieve through guided meditation & breathing techniques. 

The workshop also offers a preview of a longer workshop called The Happiness program.

The Happiness Program teaches several practical and powerful tools to help you discover your unlimited power and freedom - not as a concept, but as a direct experience. 

You will discover that you can be happy, whatever the situation, and live a deeply fulfilling life. 

More @ Behappymc.org

results.description:
Join us for an evening of collaborative drawing experiments!

In this Creative Safe-Space for individuals with past or present experience of mental health issues/extreme states, we will be exploring:

1. "Spanking Yoda"

Everyone gets a sheet of paper and writes a sentence at the top. Next, pass the paper to the person on your right. That person will read your sentence, draw a picture interpretation beneath it, then fold the paper so only the drawing shows. After that, you pass to the right again and interpret the picture with another sentence. Once the papers are filled completely, throw them in the center. Everyone selects a random paper and reads the whole “story” that has been created. It’s like Telephone, but better, and with tiny drawings.

2. Visual Telephone

Everyone gets a sheet of paper and draws something on it. When done, everyone passes their drawing to the person on their left and receives a drawing from the person on their right. Everyone then takes a new piece of paper, draws their interpretation of the drawing they just received, and passes this interpretation to the person on their left, with the original drawing underneath it. This drawing is then interpreted, and so forth. In the end there will be stacks of drawings showing the evolution of each original drawing.

As always, there will be plenty of time to hang out and get to know one another during (and possibly after) the event!

Hope to see you there!

-Josh K.

Note: the number of RSVPs for this event in this meetup is not representative of how many people will be at the actual event, as these events are being advertised outside of this meetup.
results.name: "Spanking Yoda" (Drawing Game) + Visual Telephone

group.name: PROPELLER: Mental Wellness Through Community & Advocacy

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
